Microsoft Internet Explorer 6.0 does not clearly associate a
Javascript dialog box with the web page that generated it, which
allows remote attackers to spoof a dialog box from a trusted site and
facilitates phishing attacks, aka the "Dialog Origin Spoofing
Vulnerability."

Reference: URL:http://securityreason.com/securityalert/254
Reference: XF:ie-dialog-box-code-execution(23448)
Reference: URL:http://xforce.iss.net/xforce/xfdb/23448

Multiple design errors in Microsoft Internet Explorer 5.01, 5.5, and 6
allow user-assisted attackers to execute arbitrary code by (1)
overlaying a malicious new window above a file download box, then (2)
using a keyboard shortcut and delaying the display of the file
download box until the user hits a shortcut that activates the "Run"
button, aka "File Download Dialog Box Manipulation Vulnerability."

======================================================
Name: CVE-2005-3310
Status: Candidate
URL: http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2005-3310
Phase: Assigned (20051026)
Category: SF
Reference: BUGTRAQ:20051022 phpBB 2.0.17 (and other BB systems as well) Cookie disclosure
Reference: URL:http://marc.theaimsgroup.com/?l=bugtraq&m=113017003617987&w=2
Reference: FULLDISC:20051022 phpBB 2.0.17 (and other BB systems as well) Cookie disclosure exploit.
Reference: URL:http://archives.neohapsis.com/archives/fulldisclosure/2005-10/0479.html
Reference: DEBIAN:DSA-925
Reference: URL:http://www.debian.org/security/2005/dsa-925
Reference: BID:15170
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/15170
Reference: SECUNIA:17295
Reference: URL:http://secunia.com/advisories/17295/
Reference: SECUNIA:18098
Reference: URL:http://secunia.com/advisories/18098
Reference: XF:phpbb-avatar-bypass-security(22837)
Reference: URL:http://xforce.iss.net/xforce/xfdb/22837

Interpretation conflict in phpBB 2.0.17, with remote avatars and
avatar uploading enabled, allows remote authenticated users to inject
arbitrary web script or HTML via an HTML file with a GIF or JPEG file
extension, which causes the HTML to be executed by a victim who views
the file in Internet Explorer, which renders malformed image types as
HTML, enabling cross-site scripting (XSS) attacks.  NOTE: it could be
argued that this vulnerability is due to a design flaw in Internet
Explorer (CVE-2005-3312) and the proper fix should be in that browser;
if so, then this should not be treated as a vulnerability in phpBB.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)


======================================================
Name: CVE-2005-3312
Status: Candidate
URL: http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2005-3312
Phase: Assigned (20051026)
Category: SF
Reference: MISC:http://www.scip.ch/cgi-bin/smss/showadvf.pl?id=1746
Reference: MISC:http://www.computec.ch/download.php?view.683
Reference: MISC:http://www.securiteam.com/windowsntfocus/6F00B00EBY.html
Reference: BUGTRAQ:20051022 phpBB 2.0.17 (and other BB systems as well) Cookie disclosure
Reference: URL:http://marc.theaimsgroup.com/?l=bugtraq&m=113017003617987&w=2
Reference: SREASON:18
Reference: URL:http://securityreason.com/securityalert/18

The HTML rendering engine in Microsoft Internet Explorer 6.0 allows
remote attackers to conduct cross-site scripting (XSS) attacks via
HTML in corrupted images and other files such as .GIF, JPG, and WAV,
which is rendered as HTML when the user clicks on the link, even
though the web server response and file extension indicate that it
should be treated as a different file type.

Invision Gallery 2.0.3 allows remote attackers to conduct cross-site

CVE-2005-3312.  NOTE: it could be argued that this vulnerability is

Disclosure Vulnerability."

======================================================
Name: CVE-2005-4269
Status: Candidate
URL: http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2005-4269
Phase: Assigned (20051215)
Category: 
Reference: MSKB:908233
Reference: URL:http://support.microsoft.com/kb/908233/
Reference: MISC:http://www.securiteam.com/windowsntfocus/6V00B1FEUE.html

mshtml.dll in Microsoft Windows XP, Server 2003, and Internet Explorer
6.0 SP1 allows attackers to cause a denial of service (access
violation) by causing mshtml.dll to process button-focus events at the
same time that a document is reloading, as seen in Microsoft Office
InfoPath 2003 by repeatedly clicking the "Delete" button in a
repeating section in a form.  NOTE: the normal operation of InfoPath
appears to involve a local user without any privilege boundaries, so
this might not be a vulnerability in InfoPath.  If no realistic
scenarios exist for this problem in other products, then perhaps it
should be excluded from CVE.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)


======================================================
Name: CVE-2005-4426
Status: Candidate
URL: http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2005-4426
Phase: Assigned (20051220)
Category: 
Reference: CONFIRM:http://www.yabbforum.com/downloads.php
Reference: BID:15368
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/15368
Reference: SECUNIA:17411
Reference: URL:http://secunia.com/advisories/17411
Reference: XF:yabb-image-attachment-xss(23020)
Reference: URL:http://xforce.iss.net/xforce/xfdb/23020

Interpretation conflict in YaBB before 2.1 allows remote authenticated
users to inject arbitrary web script or HTML via HTML in a file with a
GIF file extension, which causes the HTML to be executed by a victim
who views the file in Internet Explorer as a result of CVE-2005-3312.
NOTE: it could be argued that this vulnerability is due to a design
flaw in Internet Explorer and the proper fix should be in that
browser; if so, then this should not be treated as a vulnerability in
YaBB.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)

======================================================
Name: CVE-2005-4827
Status: Candidate
URL: http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2005-4827
Phase: Assigned (20070207)
Category: 
Reference: BUGTRAQ:20050924 "Exploiting the XmlHttpRequest object in IE" - paper by Amit Klein
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/archive/1/411585
Reference: FULLDISC:20070203 Web 2.0 backdoors made easy with MSIE & XMLHttpRequest
Reference: URL:http://seclists.org/fulldisclosure/2007/Feb/0081.html
Reference: BUGTRAQ:20070203 Re: Web 2.0 backdoors made easy with MSIE & XMLHttpRequest
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/archive/1/archive/1/459172/100/0/threaded
Reference: BUGTRAQ:20070204 Re: Web 2.0 backdoors made easy with MSIE & XMLHttpRequest
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/archive/1/459172/100/0/threaded
Reference: BID:14969
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/14969

Internet Explorer 6.0, and possibly other versions, allows remote
attackers to bypass the same origin security policy and make requests
outside of the intended domain by calling open on an XMLHttpRequest
object (Microsoft.XMLHTTP) and using tab, newline, and carriage return
characters within the first argument (method name), which is supported
by some proxy servers that convert tabs to spaces.  NOTE: this issue
can be leveraged to conduct referer spoofing, HTTP Request Smuggling,
and other attacks.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)

6, allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (NULL

Name: CVE-2006-0799

Phase: Assigned (20060219)
Category: SF
Reference: BUGTRAQ:20060216 Internet Explorer Phishing mouseover issue

Reference: URL:http://www.osvdb.org/23609
Reference: XF:ie-ahref-status-spoofing(17938)
Reference: URL:http://xforce.iss.net/xforce/xfdb/17938

Microsoft Internet Explorer allows remote attackers to spoof a
legitimate URL in the status bar and conduct a phishing attack via a
web page with an anchor element with a legitimate "href" attribute, a
form whose action points to a malicious URL, and an INPUT submit
element that is modified to look like a legitimate URL.  NOTE: this
issue is very similar to CVE-2004-1104, although the manipulations are
slightly different.

Category:

Reference: URL:http://xforce.iss.net/xforce/xfdb/24788

The scripting engine in Internet Explorer allows remote attackers to
cause a denial of service (resource consumption) and possibly execute
arbitrary code via a web page that contains a recurrent call to an
infinite loop in Javascript or VBscript, which consumes the stack, as
demonstrated by resetting the "location" variable within the loop.

correct IOleClientSite information when dynamically creating an

Reference: OVAL:oval:org.mitre.oval:def:1973
Reference: URL:http://oval.mitre.org/repository/data/getDef?id=oval:org.mitre.oval:def:1973
Reference: OVAL:oval:org.mitre.oval:def:2017
Reference: URL:http://oval.mitre.org/repository/data/getDef?id=oval:org.mitre.oval:def:2017
Reference: SECTRACK:1016291
Reference: URL:http://securitytracker.com/id?1016291
Reference: SECUNIA:20595
Reference: URL:http://secunia.com/advisories/20595
Reference: XF:ie-wmm2fxadll-execute-code(26774)
Reference: URL:http://xforce.iss.net/xforce/xfdb/26774

Multiple unspecified vulnerabilities in Microsoft Internet Explorer
5.01 SP4 and 6 SP1 and earlier allow remote attackers to execute
arbitrary code by instantiating certain COM objects from Wmm2fxa.dll
as ActiveX controls including (1)
DXImageTransform.Microsoft.MMSpecialEffect1Input, (2)
DXImageTransform.Microsoft.MMSpecialEffect1Input.1, (3)
DXImageTransform.Microsoft.MMSpecialEffect2Inputs, (4)
DXImageTransform.Microsoft.MMSpecialEffect2Inputs.1, (5)
DXImageTransform.Microsoft.MMSpecialEffectInplace1Input, and (6)
DXImageTransform.Microsoft.MMSpecialEffectInplace1Input.1, which
causes memory corruption during garbage collection.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2006-1476
Status: Candidate
URL: http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2006-1476
Phase: Assigned (20060328)
Category: 
Reference: BUGTRAQ:20060324 Microsoft Windows XP SP2 Firewall issue
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/archive/1/archive/1/428970/100/0/threaded
Reference: BUGTRAQ:20060327 Re: Microsoft Windows XP SP2 Firewall issue
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/archive/1/archive/1/429111/100/0/threaded
Reference: XF:winxp-firewall-exe-bypass(25598)
Reference: URL:http://xforce.iss.net/xforce/xfdb/25598

Windows Firewall in Microsoft Windows XP SP2 produces incorrect
application block alerts when the application filename is ".exe" (with
no characters before the "."), which might allow local user-assisted
users to trick a user into unblocking a Trojan horse program, as
demonstrated by a malicious ".exe" program in a folder named "Internet
Explorer," which triggers a question about whether to unblock the
"Internet Explorer" program.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)

Reference: URL:http://oval.mitre.org/repository/data/getDef?id=oval:org.mitre.oval:def:1918

Internet Explorer 6 for Windows XP SP2 and earlier allows remote
attackers to spoof the address bar and possibly conduct phishing
attacks by re-opening the window to a malicious Shockwave Flash
application, then changing the window location back to a trusted URL
while the Flash application is still loading.  NOTE: this is a
different vulnerability than CVE-2006-1192.

possibly conduct phishing attacks by re-opening the window to a

loading.  NOTE: a followup was unable to replicate this issue.

mshtml.dll 6.00.2900.2873, as used in Microsoft Internet Explorer,
allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (crash) via
nested OBJECT tags, which trigger invalid pointer dereferences
including NULL dereferences.  NOTE: the possibility of code execution
was originally theorized, but Microsoft has stated that this issue is
non-exploitable.

Status: Candidate

Argument injection vulnerability in Internet Explorer 6 for Windows XP
SP2 allows user-assisted remote attackers to modify command line
arguments to an invoked mail client via " (double quote) characters in
a mailto: scheme handler, as demonstrated by launching Microsoft
Outlook with an arbitrary filename as an attachment.  NOTE: it is not
clear whether this issue is implementation-specific or a problem in
the Microsoft API.

Category: 
Reference: FULLDISC:20040407 Race conditions in security dialogs
Reference: URL:http://archives.neohapsis.com/archives/fulldisclosure/2004-07/0264.html
Reference: FULLDISC:20060426 Internet Explorer User Interface Races, Redeux
Reference: URL:http://archives.neohapsis.com/archives/fulldisclosure/2006-04/0759.html
Reference: FULLDISC:20060427 PoC for Internet Explorer Modal Dialog Issue
Reference: URL:http://lists.grok.org.uk/pipermail/full-disclosure/2006-April/045589.html
Reference: VULNWATCH:20060427 PoC for Internet Explorer Modal Dialog Issue
Reference: URL:http://archives.neohapsis.com/archives/vulnwatch/2006-q2/0019.html
Reference: MISC:http://student.missouristate.edu/m/matthew007/advisories.asp?adv=2006-02
Reference: MISC:http://www.squarefree.com/2004/07/01/race-conditions-in-security-dialogs/
Reference: BID:17713
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/17713
Reference: VUPEN:ADV-2006-1559
Reference: URL:http://www.vupen.com/english/advisories/2006/1559
Reference: OSVDB:22351
Reference: URL:http://www.osvdb.org/22351
Reference: SECTRACK:1015720
Reference: URL:http://securitytracker.com/id?1015720
Reference: XF:ie-modal-dialog-code-execution(26111)
Reference: URL:http://xforce.iss.net/xforce/xfdb/26111

Microsoft Internet Explorer before Windows XP Service Pack 2 and
Windows Server 2003 Service Pack 1, when Prompt is configured in
Security Settings, uses modal dialogs to verify that a user wishes to
run an ActiveX control or perform other risky actions, which allows
user-assisted remote attackers to construct a race condition that
tricks a user into clicking an object or pressing keys that are
actually applied to a "Yes" approval for executing the control.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)

======================================================
Name: CVE-2006-2900
Status: Candidate
URL: http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2006-2900
Phase: Assigned (20060607)
Category: 
Reference: FULLDISC:20060605 file upload widgets in IE and Firefox have issues
Reference: URL:http://lists.grok.org.uk/pipermail/full-disclosure/2006-June/046610.html
Reference: BID:18308
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/18308
Reference: VUPEN:ADV-2006-2161
Reference: URL:http://www.vupen.com/english/advisories/2006/2161
Reference: SECUNIA:20449
Reference: URL:http://secunia.com/advisories/20449
Reference: SREASON:1059
Reference: URL:http://securityreason.com/securityalert/1059

Internet Explorer 6 allows user-assisted remote attackers to read
arbitrary files by tricking a user into typing the characters of the
target filename in a text box and using the OnKeyDown, OnKeyPress, and
OnKeyUp Javascript keystroke events to change the focus and cause
those characters to be inserted into a file upload input control,
which can then upload the file when the user submits the form.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)

Name: CVE-2006-3227
Status: Candidate
URL: http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2006-3227
Phase: Assigned (20060626)
Category: 
Reference: BUGTRAQ:20060621 Bypassing of web filters by using ASCII
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/archive/1/archive/1/437948/100/0/threaded
Reference: BUGTRAQ:20060621 Re: Bypassing of web filters by using ASCII
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/archive/1/archive/1/438049/100/0/threaded
Reference: BUGTRAQ:20060621 Re: Bypassing of web filters by using ASCII
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/archive/1/438051/100/0/threaded
Reference: BUGTRAQ:20060622 Re: Bypassing of web filters by using ASCII
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/archive/1/archive/1/438066/100/0/threaded
Reference: BUGTRAQ:20060623 RE: Bypassing of web filters by using ASCII
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/archive/1/archive/1/438154/100/0/threaded
Reference: BUGTRAQ:20060623 Re: Bypassing of web filters by using ASCII
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/archive/1/archive/1/438163/100/0/threaded
Reference: BUGTRAQ:20060626 RE: Bypassing of web filters by using ASCII
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/archive/1/archive/1/438359/100/0/threaded
Reference: BUGTRAQ:20060626 Re: Bypassing of web filters by using ASCII
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/archive/1/archive/1/438358/100/0/threaded
Reference: MISC:http://ha.ckers.org/blog/20060621/us-ascii-xss-part-2
Reference: MISC:http://ha.ckers.org/blog/20060621/malformed-ascii-bypasses-filters/
Reference: OSVDB:28376
Reference: URL:http://www.osvdb.org/28376
Reference: XF:ie-ascii-encoded-web-filter-bypass(27288)
Reference: URL:http://xforce.iss.net/xforce/xfdb/27288

Interpretation conflict between Internet Explorer and other web
browsers such as Mozilla, Opera, and Firefox might allow remote
attackers to modify the visual presentation of web pages and possibly
bypass protection mechanisms such as content filters via ASCII
characters with the 8th bit set, which could be stripped by Internet
Explorer to render legible text, but not when using other browsers.
NOTE: there has been significant discussion about this issue, and as
of 20060625, it is not clear where the responsibility for this issue
lies, although it might be due to vagueness within the associated
standards.  NOTE: this might only be exploitable with certain
encodings.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)

Reference: URL:http://www.vupen.com/english/advisories/2006/2553

Reference: URL:http://www.vupen.com/english/advisories/2006/3212

Reference: URL:http://securitytracker.com/id?1016388
Reference: SECUNIA:20825
Reference: URL:http://secunia.com/advisories/20825
Reference: SECUNIA:21396
Reference: URL:http://secunia.com/advisories/21396
Reference: XF:ie-redirection-information-disclosure(27452)
Reference: URL:http://xforce.iss.net/xforce/xfdb/27452

Cross-domain vulnerability in Microsoft Internet Explorer 6.0 allows
remote attackers to access restricted information from other domains
via an object tag with a data parameter that references a link on the
attacker's originating site that specifies a Location HTTP header that
references the target site, which then makes that content available
through the outerHTML attribute of the object, aka "Redirect
Cross-Domain Information Disclosure Vulnerability."

None (candidate not yet proposed)

Name: CVE-2006-3281
Status: Candidate
URL: http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2006-3281
Phase: Assigned (20060628)
Category: 
Reference: FULLDISC:20060627 IE_ONE_MINOR_ONE_MAJOR
Reference: URL:http://lists.grok.org.uk/pipermail/full-disclosure/2006-June/047398.html
Reference: MISC:http://lists.grok.org.uk/pipermail/full-disclosure/attachments/20060627/3d930eda/PLEBO-2006.06.16-IE_ONE_MINOR_ONE_MAJOR.obj
Reference: MS:MS06-045
Reference: URL:http://www.microsoft.com/technet/security/Bulletin/MS06-045.mspx
Reference: CERT:TA06-220A
Reference: URL:http://www.us-cert.gov/cas/techalerts/TA06-220A.html
Reference: CERT-VN:VU#655100
Reference: URL:http://www.kb.cert.org/vuls/id/655100
Reference: BID:19389
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/19389
Reference: VUPEN:ADV-2006-2553
Reference: URL:http://www.vupen.com/english/advisories/2006/2553
Reference: OVAL:oval:org.mitre.oval:def:318
Reference: URL:http://oval.mitre.org/repository/data/getDef?id=oval:org.mitre.oval:def:318
Reference: SECTRACK:1016388
Reference: URL:http://securitytracker.com/id?1016388
Reference: SECUNIA:20825
Reference: URL:http://secunia.com/advisories/20825
Reference: XF:ie-hta-fileshare-command-execution(27456)
Reference: URL:http://xforce.iss.net/xforce/xfdb/27456

Microsoft Internet Explorer 6.0 does not properly handle Drag and Drop
events, which allows remote user-assisted attackers to execute
arbitrary code via a link to an SMB file share with a filename that
contains encoded ..\ (%2e%2e%5c) sequences and whose extension
contains the CLSID Key identifier for HTML Applications (HTA), aka
"Folder GUID Code Execution Vulnerability."  NOTE: directory traversal
sequences were used in the original exploit, although their role is
not clear.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)


======================================================
Name: CVE-2006-3354
Status: Candidate
URL: http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2006-3354

Microsoft Internet Explorer 6 allows remote attackers to cause a
denial of service (crash) by setting the Filter property of an
ADODB.Recordset ActiveX object to certain values multiple times, which
triggers a null dereference.

Reference: XF:ie-hhctrl-bo(27573)
Reference: URL:http://xforce.iss.net/xforce/xfdb/27573

in Microsoft Internet Explorer 6.0 allows remote attackers to cause a
denial of service (application crash) and possibly execute arbitrary
code by repeatedly setting the Image field of an Internet.HHCtrl.1
object to certain values, possibly related to improper escaping and
long strings.

Category:

Reference: URL:http://secunia.com/advisories/25172
Reference: XF:symantec-navopts-security-bypass(34200)
Reference: URL:http://xforce.iss.net/xforce/xfdb/34200

The Symantec NAVOPTS.DLL ActiveX control (aka
Symantec.Norton.AntiVirus.NAVOptions) 12.2.0.13, as used in Norton
AntiVirus, Internet Security, and System Works 2005 and 2006, is
designed for use only in application-embedded web browsers, which
allows remote attackers to "crash the control" via unspecified vectors
related to content on a web site, and place Internet Explorer into a
"defunct state" in which remote attackers can execute arbitrary code
in addition to other Symantec ActiveX controls, regardless of whether
they are marked safe for scripting.  NOTE: this CVE was inadvertently
used for an E-mail Auto-Protect issue, but that issue has been
assigned CVE-2007-3771.

Reference: URL:http://www.osvdb.org/31329

Internet Explorer 6 on Windows XP SP2 allows remote attackers to
execute arbitrary JavaScript in the context of the browser's session
with an arbitrary intranet web server, by hosting script on an
Internet web server that can be made inaccessible by the attacker and
that has a domain name under the attacker's control, which can force
the browser to drop DNS pinning and perform a new DNS query for the
domain name after the script is already running.

Reference: OSVDB:31882
Reference: URL:http://www.osvdb.org/31882

Reference: URL:http://oval.mitre.org/repository/data/getDef?id=oval:org.mitre.oval:def:214

The Execute method in the ADODB.Connection 2.7 and 2.8 ActiveX control
objects (ADODB.Connection.2.7 and ADODB.Connection.2.8) in the
Microsoft Data Access Components (MDAC) 2.5 SP3, 2.7 SP1, 2.8, and 2.8
SP1 does not properly track freed memory when the second argument is a
BSTR, which allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service
(Internet Explorer crash) and possibly execute arbitrary code via
certain strings in the second and third arguments.

security certificate from a secure web site to appear invalid via a
link to res://ieframe.dll/invalidcert.htm with the target site as an
argument, which displays the site's URL in the address bar but causes
Internet Explorer to report that the certificate is invalid.

security certificate from a secure web site to appear invalid via a
link to res://ieframe.dll/sslnavcancel.htm with the target site in the

but causes Internet Explorer to report that the certificate is
invalid, or (2) trigger a "The webpage no longer exists" report via a
link to res://ieframe.dll/http_410.htm, a variant of CVE-2006-5805.

Name: CVE-2006-7066

Phase: Assigned (20070227)
Category: 
Reference: BUGTRAQ:20090725 DoS vulnerabilities in Internet Explorer
Reference: URL:http://archives.neohapsis.com/archives/bugtraq/2009-07/0193.html

Reference: URL:http://xforce.iss.net/xforce/xfdb/28068

Microsoft Internet Explorer 6 on Windows XP SP2 allows remote
attackers to cause a denial of service (crash) by creating an object
inside an iframe, deleting the frame by setting its location.href to
about:blank, then accessing a property of the object within the
deleted frame, which triggers a NULL pointer dereference.  NOTE: it
was later reported that 7.0.6000.16473 and earlier are also affected.

HTML in Internet Explorer via unknown vectors related to the uploaded
attachments form.  NOTE: some details were obtained from third party
information.

Microsoft Internet Explorer 6 on Windows XP SP2 allows remote
attackers to cause a denial of service (crash) by creating a
ADODB.Recordset object and making a series of calls to the
NextRecordset method with a long string argument, which causes an
"invalid memory access" in the SysFreeString function, a different
issue than CVE-2006-3510 and CVE-2006-3899.

Stack-based buffer overflow in the animated cursor code in Microsoft
Windows 2000 SP4 through Vista allows remote attackers to execute
arbitrary code or cause a denial of service (persistent reboot) via a
large length value in the second (or later) anih block of a RIFF .ANI,
cur, or .ico file, which results in memory corruption when processing
cursors, animated cursors, and icons, a variant of CVE-2005-0416, as
originally demonstrated using Internet Explorer 6 and 7. NOTE: this
might be a duplicate of CVE-2007-1765; if so, then CVE-2007-0038
should be preferred.

Multiple cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerabilities in Adobe Acrobat
Reader Plugin before 8.0.0, and possibly the plugin distributed with
Adobe Reader 7.x before 7.1.4, 8.x before 8.1.7, and 9.x before 9.2,
for Mozilla Firefox, Microsoft Internet Explorer 6 SP1, Google Chrome,
Opera 8.5.4 build 770, and Opera 9.10.8679 on Windows allow remote
attackers to inject arbitrary JavaScript and conduct other attacks via
a .pdf URL with a javascript: or res: URI with (1) FDF, (2) XML, and
(3) XFDF AJAX parameters, or (4) an arbitrarily named name=URI anchor
identifier, aka "Universal XSS (UXSS)."

Race condition in the msxml3 module in Microsoft XML Core Services
3.0, as used in Internet Explorer 6 and other applications, allows
remote attackers to execute arbitrary code or cause a denial of
service (application crash) via many nested tags in an XML document in
an IFRAME, when synchronous document rendering is frequently disrupted
with asynchronous events, as demonstrated using a JavaScript timer,
which can trigger NULL pointer dereferences or memory corruption, aka
"MSXML Memory Corruption Vulnerability."

Reference: URL:http://www.osvdb.org/34400

Microsoft Internet Explorer 5.01 SP4 on Windows 2000 SP4; 6 SP1 on
Windows 2000 SP4; and 6 on Windows XP SP2, or Windows Server 2003 SP1
or SP2 allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code by calling
deleteCell on a named table row in a named table column, then
accessing the column, which causes Internet Explorer to access
previously deleted objects, aka the "Uninitialized Memory Corruption
Vulnerability."

charset from the parent window when a charset is not specified in an
HTTP Content-Type header or META tag, which allows remote attackers to
conduct cross-site scripting (XSS) attacks, as demonstrated using the
UTF-7 character set.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2007-1692
Status: Candidate
URL: http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2007-1692
Phase: Assigned (20070326)
Category: 
Reference: MLIST:[ISN] 20070326 Windows weakness can lead to network traffic hijacks
Reference: URL:http://archives.neohapsis.com/archives/isn/2007-q1/0418.html
Reference: MISC:http://isc.sans.org/diary.html?storyid=2517
Reference: MISC:http://news.com.com/Windows+weakness+can+lead+to+network+traffic+hijacks/2100-1002_3-6170229.html
Reference: MSKB:934864
Reference: URL:http://support.microsoft.com/kb/934864
Reference: VUPEN:ADV-2007-1115
Reference: URL:http://www.vupen.com/english/advisories/2007/1115
Reference: XF:windows-wpad-information-disclosure(33244)
Reference: URL:http://xforce.iss.net/xforce/xfdb/33244
Reference: XF:win-wpad-information-disclosure(33244)
Reference: URL:http://xforce.iss.net/xforce/xfdb/33244

The default configuration of Microsoft Windows uses the Web Proxy
Autodiscovery Protocol (WPAD) without static WPAD entries, which might
allow remote attackers to intercept web traffic by registering a proxy
server using WINS or DNS, then responding to WPAD requests, as
demonstrated using Internet Explorer.  NOTE: it could be argued that
if an attacker already has control over WINS/DNS, then web traffic
could already be intercepted by modifying WINS or DNS records, so this
would not cross privilege boundaries and would not be a
vulnerability.  It has also been reported that DHCP is an alternate
attack vector.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)

Integer underflow in the CDownloadSink class code in the Vector Markup
Language (VML) component (VGX.DLL), as used in Internet Explorer 5.01,
6, and 7 allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code via
compressed content with an invalid buffer size, which triggers a
heap-based buffer overflow.

Race condition in Microsoft Internet Explorer 6 SP1; 6 and 7 for
Windows XP SP2 and SP3; 6 and 7 for Server 2003 SP2; 7 for Vista Gold,
SP1, and SP2; and 7 for Server 2008 SP2 allows remote attackers to
execute arbitrary code or perform other actions upon a page
transition, with the permissions of the old page and the content of
the new page, as demonstrated by setInterval functions that set
location.href within a try/catch expression, aka the "bait & switch
vulnerability" or "Race Condition Cross-Domain Information Disclosure
Vulnerability."

Name: CVE-2007-3164
Status: Candidate
URL: http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2007-3164
Phase: Assigned (20070611)
Category: 
Reference: MISC:http://ha.ckers.org/blog/20070608/cross-domain-basic-auth-phishing-tactics/
Reference: MISC:http://www.bitsploit.de/archives/428-Cross-Domain-Basic-Auth-Phishing-Tactics.html
Reference: BID:24483
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/24483
Reference: OSVDB:36142
Reference: URL:http://osvdb.org/36142
Reference: SECUNIA:25663
Reference: URL:http://secunia.com/advisories/25663
Reference: XF:ie-idn-authentication-spoofing(34867)
Reference: URL:http://xforce.iss.net/xforce/xfdb/34867

Microsoft Internet Explorer 7, when prompting for HTTP Basic
Authentication for an IDN web site, uses ACE labels for the domain
name in the status bar, but uses internationalized labels for this
name in the authentication dialog, which might allow remote attackers
to perform phishing attacks if the user misinterprets confusable
characters in the internationalized labels, as demonstrated by
displaying xn--theshmogroup-bgk.com only in the status bar.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2007-3481

URL: http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2007-3481

Reference: BID:24704
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/24704
Reference: OSVDB:38953
Reference: URL:http://osvdb.org/38953

** DISPUTED **

Cross-domain vulnerability in Microsoft Internet Explorer 6 and 7
allows remote attackers to bypass the Same Origin Policy and access
restricted information from other domains via JavaScript that
overwrites the document variable and statically sets the
document.domain attribute.  NOTE: this issue has been disputed by
other researchers, citing a variable scoping issue and information
about the semantics of document.domain.

Phase: Assigned (20070703)
Category:

Reference: URL:http://xforce.iss.net/xforce/xfdb/35455

** DISPUTED **

Microsoft Internet Explorer 6.0 and 7.0 allows remote attackers to
fill Zones with arbitrary domains using certain metacharacters such as
wildcards via JavaScript, which results in a denial of service
(website suppression and resource consumption), aka "Internet Explorer
Zone Domain Specification Dos and Page Suppressing".  NOTE: this issue
has been disputed by a third party, who states that the zone settings
cannot be manipulated.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2007-3576
Status: Candidate
URL: http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2007-3576
Phase: Assigned (20070705)
Category: 
Reference: MISC:http://groups.google.com/group/php-ids/browse_thread/thread/3ec15f69d6b3dba0
Reference: MISC:http://ha.ckers.org/blog/20070702/ie60-protocol-guessing/
Reference: MISC:http://sla.ckers.org/forum/read.php?2,13209,13218
Reference: MISC:http://www.0x000000.com/?i=375
Reference: OSVDB:45813
Reference: URL:http://osvdb.org/45813

** DISPUTED **

Microsoft Internet Explorer 6 executes web script from URIs of
arbitrary scheme names ending with the "script" character sequence,
using the (1) vbscript: handler for scheme names with 7 through 9
characters, and the (2) javascript: handler for scheme names with 10
or more characters, which might allow remote attackers to bypass
certain XSS protection schemes.  NOTE: other researchers dispute the
significance of this issue, stating "this only works when typed in the
address bar."


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)

allows remote attackers to conduct cross-browser scripting attacks and
execute arbitrary commands via shell metacharacters in a (1)
FirefoxURL or (2) FirefoxHTML URI, which are inserted into the command
line that is created when invoking firefox.exe.  NOTE: it has been
debated as to whether the issue is in Internet Explorer or Firefox.
As of 20070711, it is CVE's opinion that IE appears to be failing to
properly delimit the URL argument when invoking Firefox, and this
issue could arise with other protocol handlers in IE as well.
However, Mozilla has stated that it will address the issue with a
"defense in depth" fix that will "prevent IE from sending Firefox
malicious data."


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)

Reference: BID:25945
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/25945
Reference: OVAL:oval:org.mitre.oval:def:4581
Reference: URL:http://oval.mitre.org/repository/data/getDef?id=oval:org.mitre.oval:def:4581
Reference: SECTRACK:1018822
Reference: URL:http://www.securitytracker.com/id?1018822
Reference: SECTRACK:1018831
Reference: URL:http://securitytracker.com/id?1018831
Reference: SECUNIA:26201
Reference: URL:http://secunia.com/advisories/26201

The URL handling in Shell32.dll in the Windows shell in Microsoft
Windows XP and Server 2003, with Internet Explorer 7 installed, allows
remote attackers to execute arbitrary programs via invalid "%"
sequences in a mailto: or other URI handler, as demonstrated using
mIRC, Outlook, Firefox, Adobe Reader, Skype, and other applications.
NOTE: this issue might be related to other issues involving URL
handlers in Windows systems, such as CVE-2007-3845. There also might
be separate but closely related issues in the applications that are
invoked by the handlers.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2007-3924
Status: Candidate
URL: http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2007-3924
Phase: Assigned (20070720)
Category: 
Reference: MISC:http://sla.ckers.org/forum/read.php?3,13732,13739
Reference: SECUNIA:26082
Reference: URL:http://secunia.com/advisories/26082

Argument injection vulnerability in Microsoft Internet Explorer, when
running on systems with Netscape installed and certain URIs
registered, allows remote attackers to conduct cross-browser scripting
attacks and execute arbitrary commands via shell metacharacters in a
-chrome argument to the navigatorurl URI, which are inserted into the
command line that is created when invoking netscape.exe, a related
issue to CVE-2007-3670.  NOTE: there has been debate about whether the
issue is in Internet Explorer or Netscape. As of 20070713, it is CVE's
opinion that IE appears to not properly delimit the URL argument when
invoking Netscape; this issue could arise with other protocol handlers
in IE.

Reference: BID:24973
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/24973
Reference: VUPEN:ADV-2007-2617

Reference: URL:http://xforce.iss.net/xforce/xfdb/35501

Interpretation conflict between Microsoft Internet Explorer and
DocuWiki before 2007-06-26b allows remote attackers to inject
arbitrary JavaScript and conduct cross-site scripting (XSS) attacks
when spellchecking UTF-8 encoded messages via the spell_utf8test
function in lib/exe/spellcheck.php, which triggers HTML document
identification and script execution by Internet Explorer even though
the Content-Type header is text/plain.

The embedded Internet Explorer server control in AOL Instant Messenger
(AIM) 6.1.41.2 and 6.2.32.1, AIM Pro, and AIM Lite does not properly
constrain the use of mshtml.dll's web script and HTML functionality
for incoming instant messages, which allows remote attackers to place
HTML into unexpected contexts or execute arbitrary code, as
demonstrated by writing arbitrary HTML to a notification window, and
writing contents of arbitrary local image files to this window via IMG
SRC.

possibly Firefox, allows remote attackers to obtain sensitive
information via a '" ' (double-quote space) sequence followed by the

login credentials and software installation details to an arbitrary
URL.

Reference: OSVDB:45525
Reference: URL:http://osvdb.org/45525

Microsoft Internet Explorer 6 drops DNS pins based on failed
connections to irrelevant TCP ports, which makes it easier for remote
attackers to conduct DNS rebinding attacks, as demonstrated by a port
81 URL in an IMG SRC, when the DNS pin had been established for a
session on port 80, a different issue than CVE-2006-4560.

other extensions, a different issue than CVE-2004-1331.  NOTE: this
issue might not cross privilege boundaries, although it does bypass an
intended protection mechanism.

Name: CVE-2008-0273
Status: Candidate
URL: http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2008-0273
Phase: Assigned (20080115)
Category: 
Reference: CONFIRM:http://drupal.org/node/208564
Reference: CONFIRM:http://www.vbdrupal.org/forum/showthread.php?p=6878
Reference: CONFIRM:http://www.vbdrupal.org/forum/showthread.php?t=1349
Reference: BID:27238
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/27238
Reference: SECUNIA:28486
Reference: URL:http://secunia.com/advisories/28486
Reference: VUPEN:ADV-2008-0127
Reference: URL:http://www.vupen.com/english/advisories/2008/0127
Reference: SECUNIA:28422
Reference: URL:http://secunia.com/advisories/28422
Reference: VUPEN:ADV-2008-0134
Reference: URL:http://www.vupen.com/english/advisories/2008/0134
Reference: XF:drupal-utf8-xss(39619)
Reference: URL:http://xforce.iss.net/xforce/xfdb/39619

Interpretation conflict in Drupal 4.7.x before 4.7.11 and 5.x before
5.6, when Internet Explorer 6 is used, allows remote attackers to
conduct cross-site scripting (XSS) attacks via invalid UTF-8 byte
sequences, which are not processed as UTF-8 by Drupal's HTML
filtering, but are processed as UTF-8 by Internet Explorer,
effectively removing characters from the document and defeating the
HTML protection mechanism.

None (candidate not yet proposed)

gallery, accessible through a search within the "Add video to chat"
dialog, aka "videomood XSS."

======================================================
Name: CVE-2008-1368
Status: Candidate
URL: http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2008-1368
Phase: Assigned (20080317)
Category: 
Reference: BUGTRAQ:20080313 Rapid7 Advisory R7-0032: Microsoft Internet Explorer FTP Command Injection Vulnerability
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/archive/1/archive/1/489500/100/0/threaded
Reference: MISC:http://www.rapid7.com/advisories/R7-0032.jsp
Reference: BID:28208
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/28208
Reference: VUPEN:ADV-2008-0870
Reference: URL:http://www.vupen.com/english/advisories/2008/0870
Reference: SECUNIA:29346
Reference: URL:http://secunia.com/advisories/29346
Reference: SREASON:3750
Reference: URL:http://securityreason.com/securityalert/3750

CRLF injection vulnerability in Microsoft Internet Explorer 5 and 6
allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary FTP commands via an
ftp:// URL that contains a URL-encoded CRLF (%0D%0A) before the FTP
command, which causes the commands to be inserted into an
authenticated FTP connection established earlier in the same browser
session, as demonstrated using a DELE command, a variant or possibly a
regression of CVE-2004-1166.  NOTE: a trailing "//" can force Internet
Explorer to try to reuse an existing authenticated connection.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)

Reference: SECTRACK:1020679
Reference: URL:http://www.securitytracker.com/id?1020679
Reference: SECTRACK:1020680
Reference: URL:http://www.securitytracker.com/id?1020680
Reference: SECUNIA:31415
Reference: URL:http://secunia.com/advisories/31415

The MHTML protocol handler in a component of Microsoft Outlook Express
5.5 SP2 and 6 through SP1, and Windows Mail, does not assign the
correct Internet Explorer Security Zone to UNC share pathnames, which
allows remote attackers to bypass intended access restrictions and
read arbitrary files via an mhtml: URI in conjunction with a
redirection, aka "URL Parsing Cross-Domain Information Disclosure
Vulnerability."


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)


======================================================
Name: CVE-2008-1544
Status: Candidate
URL: http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2008-1544
Phase: Assigned (20080328)
Category: 
Reference: BUGTRAQ:20080321 [MSA02240108] IE7 allows overwriting of several headers leading to Http request Splitting and smuggling.
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/archive/1/archive/1/489954/100/0/threaded
Reference: MISC:http://www.mindedsecurity.com/MSA02240108.html
Reference: HP:HPSBST02344
Reference: URL:http://marc.info/?l=bugtraq&m=121380194923597&w=2
Reference: HP:SSRT080087
Reference: URL:http://marc.info/?l=bugtraq&m=121380194923597&w=2
Reference: MS:MS08-031
Reference: URL:http://www.microsoft.com/technet/security/bulletin/ms08-031.mspx
Reference: CERT:TA08-162B
Reference: URL:http://www.us-cert.gov/cas/techalerts/TA08-162B.html
Reference: BID:28379
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/28379
Reference: OVAL:oval:org.mitre.oval:def:5291
Reference: URL:http://oval.mitre.org/repository/data/getDef?id=oval:org.mitre.oval:def:5291
Reference: VUPEN:ADV-2008-0980
Reference: URL:http://www.vupen.com/english/advisories/2008/0980
Reference: VUPEN:ADV-2008-1778
Reference: URL:http://www.vupen.com/english/advisories/2008/1778
Reference: SECTRACK:1020226
Reference: URL:http://www.securitytracker.com/id?1020226
Reference: SECUNIA:29453
Reference: URL:http://secunia.com/advisories/29453
Reference: SREASON:3785
Reference: URL:http://securityreason.com/securityalert/3785

The setRequestHeader method of the XMLHttpRequest object in Microsoft
Internet Explorer 5.01, 6, and 7 does not block dangerous HTTP request
headers when certain 8-bit character sequences are appended to a
header name, which allows remote attackers to (1) conduct HTTP request
splitting and HTTP request smuggling attacks via an incorrect
Content-Length header, (2) access arbitrary virtual hosts via a
modified Host header, (3) bypass referrer restrictions via an
incorrect Referer header, and (4) bypass the same-origin policy and
obtain sensitive information via a crafted request header.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)


======================================================
Name: CVE-2008-1545
Status: Candidate
URL: http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2008-1545
Phase: Assigned (20080328)
Category: 
Reference: BUGTRAQ:20080321 [MSA01240108] IE7 Transfer-Encoding: chunked allows Request Splitting/Smuggling.
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/archive/1/archive/1/489960/100/0/threaded
Reference: MISC:http://www.mindedsecurity.com/MSA01240108.html
Reference: VUPEN:ADV-2008-0980
Reference: URL:http://www.vupen.com/english/advisories/2008/0980
Reference: SECUNIA:29453
Reference: URL:http://secunia.com/advisories/29453
Reference: SREASON:3786
Reference: URL:http://securityreason.com/securityalert/3786
Reference: XF:ie-setrequestheader-chunk-security-bypass(42804)
Reference: URL:http://xforce.iss.net/xforce/xfdb/42804

The setRequestHeader method of the XMLHttpRequest object in Microsoft
Internet Explorer 7 does not restrict the dangerous Transfer-Encoding
HTTP request header, which allows remote attackers to conduct HTTP
request splitting and HTTP request smuggling attacks via a POST
containing a "Transfer-Encoding: chunked" header and a request body
with an incorrect chunk size.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)

Reference: OVAL:oval:org.mitre.oval:def:8509
Reference: URL:http://oval.mitre.org/repository/data/getDef?id=oval:org.mitre.oval:def:8509
Reference: SECTRACK:1022047
Reference: URL:http://www.securitytracker.com/id?1022047
Reference: SECTRACK:1020150
Reference: URL:http://securitytracker.com/id?1020150
Reference: SECUNIA:30467
Reference: URL:http://secunia.com/advisories/30467
Reference: VUPEN:ADV-2008-1706
Reference: URL:http://www.vupen.com/english/advisories/2008/1706
Reference: VUPEN:ADV-2009-1028
Reference: URL:http://www.vupen.com/english/advisories/2009/1028
Reference: VUPEN:ADV-2009-1029
Reference: URL:http://www.vupen.com/english/advisories/2009/1029
Reference: XF:apple-safari-windows-code-execution(42765)
Reference: URL:http://xforce.iss.net/xforce/xfdb/42765

Apple Safari on Mac OS X, and before 3.1.2 on Windows, does not prompt
the user before downloading an object that has an unrecognized content
type, which allows remote attackers to place malware into the (1)
Desktop directory on Windows or (2) Downloads directory on Mac OS X,
and subsequently allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code on
Windows by leveraging an untrusted search path vulnerability in (a)
Internet Explorer 7 on Windows XP or (b) the SearchPath function in
Windows XP, Vista, and Server 2003 and 2008, aka a "Carpet Bomb" and a
"Blended Threat Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability," a different
issue than CVE-2008-1032. NOTE: Apple considers this a vulnerability
only because the Microsoft products can load application libraries
from the desktop and, as of 20080619, has not covered the issue in an
advisory for Mac OS X.

None (candidate not yet proposed)

Reference: URL:http://www.kb.cert.org/vuls/id/923508
Reference: BID:29960
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/29960
Reference: OVAL:oval:org.mitre.oval:def:5901
Reference: URL:http://oval.mitre.org/repository/data/getDef?id=oval:org.mitre.oval:def:5901
Reference: VUPEN:ADV-2008-1940
Reference: URL:http://www.vupen.com/english/advisories/2008/1940/references
Reference: VUPEN:ADV-2008-2809
Reference: URL:http://www.vupen.com/english/advisories/2008/2809
Reference: SECTRACK:1020382
Reference: URL:http://www.securitytracker.com/id?1020382
Reference: SECUNIA:30857
Reference: URL:http://secunia.com/advisories/30857
Reference: XF:ie-location-locationhref-security-bypass(43366)
Reference: URL:http://xforce.iss.net/xforce/xfdb/43366
Reference: XF:win-ms08kb956390-update(45565)
Reference: URL:http://xforce.iss.net/xforce/xfdb/45565

Cross-domain vulnerability in Microsoft Internet Explorer 5.01 SP4, 6,
and 7 allows remote attackers to access restricted information from
other domains via JavaScript that uses the Object data type for the
value of a (1) location or (2) location.href property, related to
incorrect determination of the origin of web script, aka "Window
Location Property Cross-Domain Vulnerability." NOTE: according to
Microsoft, CVE-2008-2948 and CVE-2008-2949 are duplicates of this
issue, probably different attack vectors.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)


======================================================
Name: CVE-2008-2948
Status: Candidate
URL: http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2008-2948
Phase: Assigned (20080630)
Category: 
Reference: MISC:http://blogs.zdnet.com/security/?p=1348
Reference: MISC:http://sirdarckcat.blogspot.com/2008/05/ghosts-for-ie8-and-ie75730.html
Reference: MISC:http://technet.microsoft.com/en-us/security/cc405107.aspx#EHD
Reference: MISC:http://www.gnucitizen.org/blog/ghost-busters/
Reference: CERT-VN:VU#516627
Reference: URL:http://www.kb.cert.org/vuls/id/516627
Reference: VUPEN:ADV-2008-1941
Reference: URL:http://www.vupen.com/english/advisories/2008/1941/references
Reference: SECUNIA:30851
Reference: URL:http://secunia.com/advisories/30851

Cross-domain vulnerability in Microsoft Internet Explorer 7 and 8
allows remote attackers to change the location property of a frame via
the Object data type, and use a frame from a different domain to
observe domain-independent events, as demonstrated by observing
onkeydown events with caballero-listener.  NOTE: according to
Microsoft, this is a duplicate of CVE-2008-2947, possibly a
different attack vector.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)

allows remote attackers to change the location property of a frame via
the String data type, and use a frame from a different domain to
observe domain-independent events, as demonstrated by observing
onkeydown events with caballero-listener.  NOTE: according to
Microsoft, this is a duplicate of CVE-2008-2947, possibly a
different attack vector.

gdiplus.dll in GDI+ in Microsoft Internet Explorer 6 SP1, Windows XP
SP2 and SP3, Server 2003 SP1 and SP2, Vista Gold and SP1, Server 2008,
Office XP SP3, Office 2003 SP2 and SP3, 2007 Microsoft Office System
Gold and SP1, Visio 2002 SP2, PowerPoint Viewer 2003, Works 8, Digital
Image Suite 2006, SQL Server 2000 Reporting Services SP2, SQL Server
2005 SP2, Report Viewer 2005 SP1 and 2008, and Forefront Client
Security 1.0 does not properly perform memory allocation, which allows
remote attackers to execute arbitrary code via a malformed EMF image
file, aka "GDI+ EMF Memory Corruption Vulnerability."

Microsoft Internet Explorer allows web sites to set cookies for
domains that have a public suffix with more than one dot character,
which could allow remote attackers to perform a session fixation
attack and hijack a user's HTTP session, aka "Cross-Site Cooking."
NOTE: this issue may exist because of an insufficient fix for
CVE-2004-0866.

as used in Internet Explorer, allows remote attackers to obtain
sensitive information from another domain via a crafted XML document,
related to improper error checks for external DTDs, aka "MSXML DTD
Cross-Domain Scripting Vulnerability."

using exam%A9ple.com to spoof example.com, aka MSRC ticket MSRC7900.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2008-4930
Status: Candidate
URL: http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2008-4930
Phase: Assigned (20081104)
Category: 
Reference: BUGTRAQ:20081027 MyBB 1.4.2: Multiple Vulnerabilties

MyBB (aka MyBulletinBoard) 1.4.2 does not properly handle an uploaded
file with a nonstandard file type that contains HTML sequences, which
allows remote attackers to cause that file to be processed as HTML by
Internet Explorer's content inspection, aka "Incomplete protection
against MIME-sniffing." NOTE: this could be leveraged for XSS and
other attacks.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2008-5520
Status: Candidate
URL: http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2008-5520
Phase: Assigned (20081212)
Category: 
Reference: BUGTRAQ:20081208 Multiple Vendor Anti-Virus Software Malicious WebPage Detection Bypass
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/archive/1/archive/1/498995/100/0/threaded
Reference: BUGTRAQ:20081209 Multiple Vendor Anti-Virus Software Malicious WebPage Detection Bypass -Update-

AhnLab V3 2008.12.4.1 and possibly 2008.9.13.0, when Internet Explorer
6 or 7 is used, allows remote attackers to bypass detection of malware
in an HTML document by placing an MZ header (aka "EXE info") at the
beginning, and modifying the filename to have (1) no extension, (2) a
.txt extension, or (3) a .jpg extension, as demonstrated by a document
containing a CVE-2006-5745 exploit.

Category: 
Reference: BUGTRAQ:20081208 Multiple Vendor Anti-Virus Software Malicious WebPage Detection Bypass
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/archive/1/archive/1/498995/100/0/threaded
Reference: BUGTRAQ:20081209 Multiple Vendor Anti-Virus Software Malicious WebPage Detection Bypass -Update-
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/archive/1/archive/1/499043/100/0/threaded
Reference: SREASON:4723
Reference: URL:http://securityreason.com/securityalert/4723
Reference: XF:multiple-antivirus-mzheader-code-execution(47435)
Reference: URL:http://xforce.iss.net/xforce/xfdb/47435

Avira AntiVir 7.9.0.36 and possibly 7.8.1.28, when Internet Explorer 6
or 7 is used, allows remote attackers to bypass detection of malware
in an HTML document by placing an MZ header (aka "EXE info") at the
beginning, and modifying the filename to have (1) no extension, (2) a
.txt extension, or (3) a .jpg extension, as demonstrated by a document
containing a CVE-2006-5745 exploit.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)

URL: http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2008-5546
Phase: Assigned (20081212)
Category: 
Reference: BUGTRAQ:20081208 Multiple Vendor Anti-Virus Software Malicious WebPage Detection Bypass
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/archive/1/archive/1/498995/100/0/threaded
Reference: BUGTRAQ:20081209 Multiple Vendor Anti-Virus Software Malicious WebPage Detection Bypass -Update-
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/archive/1/archive/1/499043/100/0/threaded
Reference: SREASON:4723
Reference: URL:http://securityreason.com/securityalert/4723
Reference: XF:multiple-antivirus-mzheader-code-execution(47435)
Reference: URL:http://xforce.iss.net/xforce/xfdb/47435

VirusBlokAda VBA32 3.12.8.5, when Internet Explorer 6 or 7 is used,
allows remote attackers to bypass detection of malware in an HTML
document by placing an MZ header (aka "EXE info") at the beginning,
and modifying the filename to have (1) no extension, (2) a .txt
extension, or (3) a .jpg extension, as demonstrated by a document
containing a CVE-2006-5745 exploit.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)


======================================================

HAURI ViRobot 2008.12.4.1499 and possibly 2008.9.12.1375, when
Internet Explorer 6 or 7 is used, allows remote attackers to bypass
detection of malware in an HTML document by placing an MZ header (aka
"EXE info") at the beginning, and modifying the filename to have (1)
no extension, (2) a .txt extension, or (3) a .jpg extension, as
demonstrated by a document containing a CVE-2006-5745 exploit.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2008-5551
Status: Candidate
URL: http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2008-5551
Phase: Assigned (20081212)
Category: 
Reference: BUGTRAQ:20081211 Aspect9: Internet Explorer 8.0 Beta 2 Anti-XSS Filter Vulnerabilities
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/archive/1/archive/1/499124/100/0/threaded
Reference: BID:32780
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/32780
Reference: SREASON:4724
Reference: URL:http://securityreason.com/securityalert/4724
Reference: XF:ie-antixss-xss(47277)
Reference: URL:http://xforce.iss.net/xforce/xfdb/47277

The XSS Filter in Microsoft Internet Explorer 8.0 Beta 2 allows remote
attackers to bypass the XSS protection mechanism and conduct XSS
attacks by injecting data at two different positions within an HTML
document, related to STYLE elements and the CSS expression property,
aka a "double injection."


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)


======================================================
Name: CVE-2008-5552
Status: Candidate
URL: http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2008-5552
Phase: Assigned (20081212)
Category: 
Reference: BUGTRAQ:20081211 Aspect9: Internet Explorer 8.0 Beta 2 Anti-XSS Filter Vulnerabilities
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/archive/1/archive/1/499124/100/0/threaded
Reference: XF:ie-antixss-xss(47277)
Reference: URL:http://xforce.iss.net/xforce/xfdb/47277
Reference: XF:ie-contenttype-xss-filter-bypass(47441)
Reference: URL:http://xforce.iss.net/xforce/xfdb/47441

The XSS Filter in Microsoft Internet Explorer 8.0 Beta 2 allows remote
attackers to bypass the XSS protection mechanism and conduct XSS
attacks via a CRLF sequence in conjunction with a crafted Content-Type
header, as demonstrated by a header with a utf-7 charset value.  NOTE:
the vendor has reportedly stated that the XSS Filter intentionally
does not attempt to "address every conceivable XSS attack scenario."


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)


======================================================
Name: CVE-2008-5553
Status: Candidate
URL: http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2008-5553
Phase: Assigned (20081212)
Category: 
Reference: BUGTRAQ:20081211 Aspect9: Internet Explorer 8.0 Beta 2 Anti-XSS Filter Vulnerabilities
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/archive/1/archive/1/499124/100/0/threaded
Reference: XF:ie-antixss-xss(47277)
Reference: URL:http://xforce.iss.net/xforce/xfdb/47277
Reference: XF:ie-xxssprotection-xss-filter-bypass(47442)
Reference: URL:http://xforce.iss.net/xforce/xfdb/47442

The XSS Filter in Microsoft Internet Explorer 8.0 Beta 2 disables
itself upon encountering a certain X-XSS-Protection HTTP header, which
allows remote attackers to bypass the XSS protection mechanism and
conduct XSS attacks by injecting this header after a CRLF sequence.
NOTE: the vendor has reportedly stated that the XSS Filter
intentionally does not attempt to "address every conceivable XSS
attack scenario."


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)


======================================================
Name: CVE-2008-5554
Status: Candidate
URL: http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2008-5554
Phase: Assigned (20081212)
Category: 
Reference: BUGTRAQ:20081211 Aspect9: Internet Explorer 8.0 Beta 2 Anti-XSS Filter Vulnerabilities
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/archive/1/archive/1/499124/100/0/threaded
Reference: XF:ie-antixss-xss(47277)
Reference: URL:http://xforce.iss.net/xforce/xfdb/47277
Reference: XF:ie-locationsetcookie-xss-filter-bypass(47443)
Reference: URL:http://xforce.iss.net/xforce/xfdb/47443

The XSS Filter in Microsoft Internet Explorer 8.0 Beta 2 does not
properly handle some HTTP headers that appear after a CRLF sequence in
a URI, which allows remote attackers to bypass the XSS protection
mechanism and conduct XSS or redirection attacks, as demonstrated by
the (1) Location and (2) Set-Cookie HTTP headers.  NOTE: the vendor has
reportedly stated that the XSS Filter intentionally does not attempt
to "address every conceivable XSS attack scenario."


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)


======================================================
Name: CVE-2008-5555
Status: Candidate
URL: http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2008-5555
Phase: Assigned (20081212)
Category: 
Reference: BUGTRAQ:20081211 Aspect9: Internet Explorer 8.0 Beta 2 Anti-XSS Filter Vulnerabilities
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/archive/1/archive/1/499124/100/0/threaded
Reference: XF:ie-antixss-xss(47277)
Reference: URL:http://xforce.iss.net/xforce/xfdb/47277
Reference: XF:ie-xdomainrequestallowed-xss-filter-bypass(47444)
Reference: URL:http://xforce.iss.net/xforce/xfdb/47444

Microsoft Internet Explorer 8.0 Beta 2 relies on the
XDomainRequestAllowed HTTP header to authorize data exchange between
domains, which allows remote attackers to bypass the product's XSS
Filter protection mechanism, and conduct XSS and cross-domain attacks,
by injecting this header after a CRLF sequence, related to
"XDomainRequest Allowed Injection (XAI)." NOTE: the vendor has
reportedly stated that the XSS Filter intentionally does not attempt
to "address every conceivable XSS attack scenario."


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)


======================================================
Name: CVE-2008-5556
Status: Candidate
URL: http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2008-5556
Phase: Assigned (20081212)
Category: 
Reference: BUGTRAQ:20081211 Aspect9: Internet Explorer 8.0 Beta 2 Anti-XSS Filter Vulnerabilities
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/archive/1/archive/1/499124/100/0/threaded
Reference: XF:ie-antixss-xss(47277)
Reference: URL:http://xforce.iss.net/xforce/xfdb/47277

** DISPUTED **

The XSS Filter in Microsoft Internet Explorer 8.0 Beta 2 does not
recognize attack patterns designed to operate against web pages that
are encoded with utf-7, which allows remote attackers to bypass the
XSS protection mechanism and conduct XSS attacks by injecting crafted
utf-7 content.  NOTE: the vendor reportedly disputes this issue,
stating "Behaviour is by design."


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)


======================================================
Name: CVE-2008-5715
Status: Candidate
URL: http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2008-5715
Phase: Assigned (20081224)
Category: 
Reference: BUGTRAQ:20090821 DoS vulnerabilities in Mozilla Firefox, Internet Explorer and Chrome
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/archive/1/archive/1/506006/100/0/threaded

Reference: URL:http://osvdb.org/51032

Reference: URL:http://securityreason.com/securityalert/4807
Reference: XF:firefox-locationhash-dos(47572)
Reference: URL:http://xforce.iss.net/xforce/xfdb/47572

Mozilla Firefox 3.0.5 on Windows Vista allows remote attackers to
cause a denial of service (application crash) via JavaScript code with
a long string value for the hash property (aka location.hash). NOTE:
it was later reported that earlier versions are also affected, and
that the impact is CPU consumption and application hang in unspecified
circumstances perhaps involving other platforms.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2008-5912
Status: Candidate
URL: http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2008-5912
Phase: Assigned (20090120)
Category: 
Reference: MISC:http://arstechnica.com/news.ars/post/20090113-new-method-of-phishmongering-could-fool-experienced-users.html
Reference: MISC:http://www.darkreading.com/security/attacks/showArticle.jhtml?articleID=212900161
Reference: MISC:http://www.infoworld.com/article/09/01/13/Browser_bug_could_allow_phishing_without_email_1.html
Reference: MISC:http://www.trusteer.com/files/In-session-phishing-advisory-2.pdf
Reference: BID:33276
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/33276
Reference: XF:multiple-browser-js-weak-security(48173)
Reference: URL:http://xforce.iss.net/xforce/xfdb/48173

An unspecified function in the JavaScript implementation in Microsoft
Internet Explorer creates and exposes a "temporary footprint" when
there is a current login to a web site, which makes it easier for
remote attackers to trick a user into acting upon a spoofed pop-up
message, aka an "in-session phishing attack." NOTE: as of 20090116,
the only disclosure is a vague pre-advisory with no actionable
information. However, because it is from a well-known researcher, it
is being assigned a CVE identifier for tracking purposes.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)

======================================================
Name: CVE-2008-7295
Status: Candidate
URL: http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2008-7295
Phase: Assigned (20110809)
Category: 
Reference: MISC:http://code.google.com/p/browsersec/wiki/Part2#Same-origin_policy_for_cookies
Reference: MISC:http://michael-coates.blogspot.com/2010/01/cookie-forcing-trust-your-cookies-no.html
Reference: MISC:http://scarybeastsecurity.blogspot.com/2008/11/cookie-forcing.html
Reference: MISC:http://scarybeastsecurity.blogspot.com/2011/02/some-less-obvious-benefits-of-hsts.html
Reference: MISC:https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=660053

Microsoft Internet Explorer cannot properly restrict modifications to
cookies established in HTTPS sessions, which allows man-in-the-middle
attackers to overwrite or delete arbitrary cookies via a Set-Cookie
header in an HTTP response, related to lack of the HTTP Strict
Transport Security (HSTS) includeSubDomains feature, aka a "cookie
forcing" issue.

Name: CVE-2009-0417

before 1.0.0 beta 8 allows remote attackers to inject arbitrary web
script or HTML via a crafted URL with certain characters that are not
properly handled by web browsers that do not strictly follow RFC 3986,
such as Internet Explorer 6 and 7.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2009-0419
Status: Candidate
URL: http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2009-0419
Phase: Assigned (20090204)
Category: 
Reference: MISC:https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=380418
Reference: XF:msxml-httponly-cookie-information-disclosure(48815)
Reference: URL:http://xforce.iss.net/xforce/xfdb/48815

Microsoft XML Core Services, as used in Microsoft Expression Web,
Office, Internet Explorer 6 and 7, and other products, does not
properly restrict access from web pages to Set-Cookie2 HTTP response
headers, which allows remote attackers to obtain sensitive information
from cookies via XMLHttpRequest calls, related to the HTTPOnly
protection mechanism.  NOTE: this issue reportedly exists because of an
incomplete fix for CVE-2008-4033.

function in php/Sajax.php in Sajax 0.12 allows remote attackers to
inject arbitrary web script or HTML via the URL parameter, which is

requests, such as Internet Explorer 6.  NOTE: the provenance of this

Reference: OVAL:oval:org.mitre.oval:def:6233

Reference: OVAL:oval:org.mitre.oval:def:7569
Reference: URL:http://oval.mitre.org/repository/data/getDef?id=oval:org.mitre.oval:def:7569
Reference: SECTRACK:1022041
Reference: URL:http://www.securitytracker.com/id?1022041
Reference: SECUNIA:34677
Reference: URL:http://secunia.com/advisories/34677
Reference: SECUNIA:34678
Reference: URL:http://secunia.com/advisories/34678
Reference: VUPEN:ADV-2009-1027
Reference: URL:http://www.vupen.com/english/advisories/2009/1027
Reference: VUPEN:ADV-2009-1028
Reference: URL:http://www.vupen.com/english/advisories/2009/1028

Windows HTTP Services (aka WinHTTP) in Microsoft Windows 2000 SP4, XP
SP2 and SP3, Server 2003 SP1 and SP2, Vista Gold and SP1, and Server
2008; and WinINet in Microsoft Internet Explorer 5.01 SP4, 6 SP1, 6
and 7 on Windows XP SP2 and SP3, 6 and 7 on Windows Server 2003 SP1
and SP2, 7 on Windows Vista Gold and SP1, and 7 on Windows Server
2008; allows remote web servers to capture and replay NTLM
credentials, and execute arbitrary code, via vectors related to
absence of a "credential-reflection protections" opt-in step, aka
"Windows HTTP Services Credential Reflection Vulnerability" and
"WinINet Credential Reflection Vulnerability."

None (candidate not yet proposed)

Name: CVE-2009-0551
Status: Candidate
URL: http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2009-0551
Phase: Assigned (20090212)
Category: 
Reference: CONFIRM:http://support.avaya.com/elmodocs2/security/ASA-2009-133.htm

Reference: OSVDB:53624
Reference: URL:http://osvdb.org/53624
Reference: OVAL:oval:org.mitre.oval:def:6164
Reference: URL:http://oval.mitre.org/repository/data/getDef?id=oval:org.mitre.oval:def:6164
Reference: SECTRACK:1022042
Reference: URL:http://www.securitytracker.com/id?1022042
Reference: SECUNIA:34678
Reference: URL:http://secunia.com/advisories/34678
Reference: VUPEN:ADV-2009-1028
Reference: URL:http://www.vupen.com/english/advisories/2009/1028

Microsoft Internet Explorer 6 SP1, 6 and 7 on Windows XP SP2 and SP3,
6 and 7 on Windows Server 2003 SP1 and SP2, 7 on Windows Vista Gold
and SP1, and 7 on Windows Server 2008 does not properly handle
transition errors in a request for one HTTP document followed by a
request for a second HTTP document, which allows remote attackers to
execute arbitrary code via vectors involving (1) multiple crafted
pages on a web site or (2) a web page with crafted inline content such
as banner advertisements, aka "Page Transition Memory Corruption
Vulnerability."

Mozilla Firefox before 3.0.9 and SeaMonkey 1.1.17 do not block
javascript: URIs in Refresh headers in HTTP responses, which allows
remote attackers to conduct cross-site scripting (XSS) attacks via
vectors related to (1) injecting a Refresh header or (2) specifying
the content of a Refresh header. NOTE: it was later reported that
Firefox 3.6 a1 pre and Mozilla 1.7.x and earlier are also affected.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2009-1412
Status: Candidate
URL: http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2009-1412
Phase: Assigned (20090424)
Category: 
Reference: MISC:http://chromium.googlecode.com/issues/attachment?aid=5579180911289877192&name=Google+Chrome+Advisory.doc
Reference: CONFIRM:http://code.google.com/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=9860
Reference: CONFIRM:http://googlechromereleases.blogspot.com/2009/04/stable-update-security-fix.html
Reference: XF:googlechrome-chromehtml-command-execution(50449)
Reference: URL:http://xforce.iss.net/xforce/xfdb/50449

Argument injection vulnerability in the chromehtml: protocol handler
in Google Chrome before 1.0.154.59, when invoked by Internet Explorer,
allows remote attackers to determine the existence of files, and open
tabs for URLs that do not satisfy the IsWebSafeScheme restriction, via
a web page that sets document.location to a chromehtml: value, as
demonstrated by use of a (1) javascript: or (2) data: URL.  NOTE: this
can be leveraged for Universal XSS by exploiting certain behavior
involving persistence across page transitions.

None (candidate not yet proposed)

======================================================
Name: CVE-2009-1531
Status: Candidate
URL: http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2009-1531
Phase: Assigned (20090505)
Category: 
Reference: BUGTRAQ:20090610 ZDI-09-039: Microsoft Internet Explorer onreadystatechange Memory Corruption Vulnerability

Microsoft Internet Explorer 7 for Windows XP SP2 and SP3; 7 for Server
2003 SP2; 7 for Vista Gold, SP1, and SP2; and 7 for Server 2008 SP2
allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code via frequent calls
to the getElementsByTagName function combined with the creation of an
object during reordering of elements, followed by an
onreadystatechange event, which triggers an access of an object that
(1) was not properly initialized or (2) is deleted, aka "HTML Object
Memory Corruption Vulnerability."

Name: CVE-2009-1532
Status: Candidate
URL: http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2009-1532
Phase: Assigned (20090505)
Category: 
Reference: BUGTRAQ:20090610 ZDI-09-041: Microsoft Internet Explorer 8 Rows Property Dangling Pointer Code Execution Vulnerability
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/archive/1/archive/1/504208/100/0/threaded
Reference: MISC:http://www.zerodayinitiative.com/advisories/ZDI-09-041
Reference: MS:MS09-019
Reference: URL:http://www.microsoft.com/technet/security/Bulletin/MS09-019.mspx
Reference: CERT:TA09-160A
Reference: URL:http://www.us-cert.gov/cas/techalerts/TA09-160A.html
Reference: OSVDB:54951
Reference: URL:http://osvdb.org/54951
Reference: OVAL:oval:org.mitre.oval:def:6244
Reference: URL:http://oval.mitre.org/repository/data/getDef?id=oval:org.mitre.oval:def:6244
Reference: SECTRACK:1022350
Reference: URL:http://www.securitytracker.com/id?1022350
Reference: VUPEN:ADV-2009-1538
Reference: URL:http://www.vupen.com/english/advisories/2009/1538

Microsoft Internet Explorer 8 for Windows XP SP2 and SP3; 8 for Server
2003 SP2; 8 for Vista Gold, SP1, and SP2; and 8 for Server 2008 SP2
does not properly handle objects in memory, which allows remote
attackers to execute arbitrary code via "malformed row property
references" that trigger an access of an object that (1) was not
properly initialized or (2) is deleted, leading to memory corruption,
aka "HTML Objects Memory Corruption Vulnerability" or "HTML Object
Memory Corruption Vulnerability."


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)

Reference: URL:http://secunia.com/advisories/34950

Reference: XF:drupal-utf7-xss(50250)

Cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerability in Drupal 5.x before 5.17 and
6.x before 6.11, as used in vbDrupal before 5.17.0, allows remote
attackers to inject arbitrary web script or HTML via crafted UTF-8
byte sequences before the Content-Type meta tag, which are treated as
UTF-7 by Internet Explorer 6 and 7.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2009-1823
Status: Candidate
URL: http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2009-1823
Phase: Assigned (20090529)
Category: 
Reference: CONFIRM:http://drupal.org/node/461674
Reference: BID:34954
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/34954
Reference: OSVDB:54427
Reference: URL:http://osvdb.org/54427
Reference: SECUNIA:35040
Reference: URL:http://secunia.com/advisories/35040
Reference: VUPEN:ADV-2009-1320
Reference: URL:http://www.vupen.com/english/advisories/2009/1320
Reference: XF:printeremailpdf-utf7-xss(50523)
Reference: URL:http://xforce.iss.net/xforce/xfdb/50523

Cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerability in the Print (aka Printer,
e-mail and PDF versions) module 5.x before 5.x-4.7 and 6.x before
6.x-1.7, a module for Drupal, allows remote attackers to inject
arbitrary web script or HTML by modifying a document head, before the
Content-Type META element, to contain crafted UTF-8 byte sequences
that are treated as UTF-7 by Internet Explorer 6 and 7, a related
issue to CVE-2009-1575.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2009-1844
Status: Candidate
URL: http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2009-1844
Phase: Assigned (20090601)
Category: 
Reference: CONFIRM:http://drupal.org/node/461886
Reference: DEBIAN:DSA-1808
Reference: URL:http://www.debian.org/security/2009/dsa-1808
Reference: SECUNIA:35282
Reference: URL:http://secunia.com/advisories/35282

Multiple cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerabilities in Drupal 5.x
before 5.18 and 6.x before 6.12 allow (1) remote authenticated users
to inject arbitrary web script or HTML via crafted UTF-8 byte
sequences that are treated as UTF-7 by Internet Explorer 6 and 7,
which are not properly handled in the "HTML exports of books" feature;
and (2) allow remote authenticated users with administer taxonomy
permissions to inject arbitrary web script or HTML via the help text
of an arbitrary vocabulary.  NOTE: vector 1 exists because of an
incomplete fix for CVE-2009-1575.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)

Microsoft Internet Explorer 6 SP1; Internet Explorer 6 for Windows XP
SP2 and SP3 and Server 2003 SP2; and Internet Explorer 7 and 8 for
Windows XP SP2 and SP3, Server 2003 SP2, Vista Gold, SP1, and SP2, and
Server 2008 Gold and SP2 do not properly handle attempts to access
deleted objects in memory, which allows remote attackers to execute
arbitrary code via a crafted HTML document that triggers memory
corruption, aka "Memory Corruption Vulnerability."

Category: 
Reference: BUGTRAQ:20090805 ZDI-09-047: Microsoft Internet Explorer getElementsByTagName Memory Corruption Vulnerability
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/archive/1/archive/1/505523/100/0/threaded

Reference: URL:http://www.us-cert.gov/cas/techalerts/TA09-195A.html
Reference: BID:35826
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/35826
Reference: OVAL:oval:org.mitre.oval:def:5524
Reference: URL:http://oval.mitre.org/repository/data/getDef?id=oval:org.mitre.oval:def:5524
Reference: SECTRACK:1022611
Reference: URL:http://www.securitytracker.com/id?1022611
Reference: VUPEN:ADV-2009-2033
Reference: URL:http://www.vupen.com/english/advisories/2009/2033

Microsoft Internet Explorer 5.01 SP4 and 6 SP1; Internet Explorer 6
for Windows XP SP2 and SP3 and Server 2003 SP2; and Internet Explorer
7 and 8 for Windows XP SP2 and SP3, Server 2003 SP2, Vista Gold, SP1,
and SP2, and Server 2008 Gold and SP2 do not properly handle table
operations, which allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code
via a crafted HTML document that triggers memory corruption by adding
malformed elements to an empty DIV element, related to the
getElementsByTagName method, aka "HTML Objects Memory Corruption
Vulnerability."

Name: CVE-2009-1919
Status: Candidate
URL: http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2009-1919

Reference: URL:http://www.microsoft.com/technet/security/Bulletin/MS09-034.mspx

Reference: OVAL:oval:org.mitre.oval:def:5660
Reference: URL:http://oval.mitre.org/repository/data/getDef?id=oval:org.mitre.oval:def:5660
Reference: SECTRACK:1022611
Reference: URL:http://www.securitytracker.com/id?1022611
Reference: VUPEN:ADV-2009-2033
Reference: URL:http://www.vupen.com/english/advisories/2009/2033

Microsoft Internet Explorer 5.01 SP4 and 6 SP1; Internet Explorer 6
for Windows XP SP2 and SP3 and Server 2003 SP2; and Internet Explorer
7 and 8 for Windows XP SP2 and SP3, Server 2003 SP2, Vista Gold, SP1,
and SP2, and Server 2008 Gold and SP2 do not properly handle attempts
to access deleted objects in memory, which allows remote attackers to
execute arbitrary code via an HTML document containing embedded style
sheets that modify unspecified rule properties that cause the behavior
element to be "improperly processed," aka "Uninitialized Memory
Corruption Vulnerability."

======================================================
Name: CVE-2009-1920
Status: Candidate
URL: http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2009-1920
Phase: Assigned (20090604)
Category: 
Reference: MS:MS09-045
Reference: URL:http://www.microsoft.com/technet/security/Bulletin/MS09-045.mspx
Reference: CERT:TA09-251A
Reference: URL:http://www.us-cert.gov/cas/techalerts/TA09-251A.html
Reference: OVAL:oval:org.mitre.oval:def:6316
Reference: URL:http://oval.mitre.org/repository/data/getDef?id=oval:org.mitre.oval:def:6316

The JScript scripting engine 5.1, 5.6, 5.7, and 5.8 in JScript.dll in
Microsoft Windows, as used in Internet Explorer, does not properly
load decoded scripts into memory before execution, which allows remote
attackers to execute arbitrary code via a crafted web site that
triggers memory corruption, aka "JScript Remote Code Execution
Vulnerability."
