======================================================
Name: CVE-2009-2057
Status: Candidate
URL: http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2009-2057
Phase: Assigned (20090615)
Category: 
Reference: MISC:http://research.microsoft.com/apps/pubs/default.aspx?id=79323
Reference: MISC:http://research.microsoft.com/pubs/79323/pbp-final-with-update.pdf

Microsoft Internet Explorer before 8 uses the HTTP Host header to
determine the context of a document provided in a (1) 4xx or (2) 5xx
CONNECT response from a proxy server, which allows man-in-the-middle
attackers to execute arbitrary web script by modifying this CONNECT
response, aka an "SSL tampering" attack.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)


======================================================
Name: CVE-2009-2064
Status: Candidate
URL: http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2009-2064
Phase: Assigned (20090615)
Category: 
Reference: MISC:http://research.microsoft.com/apps/pubs/default.aspx?id=79323
Reference: MISC:http://research.microsoft.com/pubs/79323/pbp-final-with-update.pdf
Reference: BID:35403
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/35403
Reference: XF:ie-https-security-bypass(51186)
Reference: URL:http://xforce.iss.net/xforce/xfdb/51186

Microsoft Internet Explorer 8, and possibly other versions, detects
http content in https web pages only when the top-level frame uses
https, which allows man-in-the-middle attackers to execute arbitrary
web script, in an https site's context, by modifying an http page to
include an https iframe that references a script file on an http site,
related to "HTTP-Intended-but-HTTPS-Loadable (HPIHSL) pages."


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)


======================================================
Name: CVE-2009-2069
Status: Candidate
URL: http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2009-2069
Phase: Assigned (20090615)
Category: 
Reference: MISC:http://research.microsoft.com/apps/pubs/default.aspx?id=79323
Reference: MISC:http://research.microsoft.com/pubs/79323/pbp-final-with-update.pdf
Reference: BID:35411
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/35411

Microsoft Internet Explorer before 8 displays a cached certificate for
a (1) 4xx or (2) 5xx CONNECT response page returned by a proxy server,
which allows man-in-the-middle attackers to spoof an arbitrary https
site by letting a browser obtain a valid certificate from this site
during one request, and then sending the browser a crafted 502
response page upon a subsequent request.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)


======================================================
Name: CVE-2009-2350
Status: Candidate
URL: http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2009-2350
Phase: Assigned (20090707)
Category: 
Reference: BUGTRAQ:20090702 Cross-Site Scripting vulnerabilities in Mozilla, Internet Explorer, Opera and Chrome
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/archive/1/archive/1/504718/100/0/threaded
Reference: BUGTRAQ:20090703 Re: Cross-Site Scripting vulnerabilities in Mozilla, Internet Explorer, Opera and Chrome
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/archive/1/archive/1/504723/100/0/threaded

Reference: MISC:http://websecurity.com.ua/3386/
Reference: BID:35570
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/35570

Microsoft Internet Explorer 6.0.2900.2180 and earlier does not block
javascript: URIs in Refresh headers in HTTP responses, which allows
remote attackers to conduct cross-site scripting (XSS) attacks via
vectors related to (1) injecting a Refresh header or (2) specifying
the content of a Refresh header, a related issue to CVE-2009-1312.

None (candidate not yet proposed)


======================================================
Name: CVE-2009-2351
Status: Candidate
URL: http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2009-2351
Phase: Assigned (20090707)
Category: 
Reference: BUGTRAQ:20090702 Cross-Site Scripting vulnerabilities in Mozilla, Internet Explorer, Opera and Chrome

Opera 9.52 and earlier does not block javascript: URIs in Refresh
headers in HTTP responses, which allows remote attackers to conduct
cross-site scripting (XSS) attacks via vectors related to (1)
injecting a Refresh header or (2) specifying the content of a Refresh
header, a related issue to CVE-2009-1312. NOTE: it was later reported
that 10.00 Beta 3 Build 1699 is also affected.

Mozilla Firefox 3.0.x, 3.5, and 3.5.1 on Windows allows remote
attackers to cause a denial of service (uncaught exception and
application crash) via a long Unicode string argument to the write
method. NOTE: this was originally reported as a stack-based buffer
overflow. NOTE: on Linux and Mac OS X, a crash resulting from this
long string reportedly occurs in an operating-system library, not in
Firefox.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2009-2500
Status: Candidate
URL: http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2009-2500

Integer overflow in GDI+ in Microsoft Internet Explorer 6 SP1, Windows
XP SP2 and SP3, Office XP SP3, Office 2003 SP3, 2007 Microsoft Office
System SP1 and SP2, Office Project 2002 SP1, Visio 2002 SP2, Office
Word Viewer, Word Viewer 2003 Gold and SP3, Office Excel Viewer 2003
Gold and SP3, Office Excel Viewer, Office PowerPoint Viewer 2007 Gold,
SP1, and SP2, Office Compatibility Pack for Word, Excel, and
PowerPoint 2007 File Formats SP1 and SP2, Expression Web, Expression
Web 2, Groove 2007 Gold and SP1, Works 8.5, SQL Server 2000 Reporting
Services SP2, SQL Server 2005 SP2 and SP3, Report Viewer 2005 SP1,
Report Viewer 2008 Gold and SP1, and Forefront Client Security 1.0
allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code via a crafted WMF
image file, aka "GDI+ WMF Integer Overflow Vulnerability."

SP1, and SP2, Office Compatibility Pack for Word, Excel, and
PowerPoint 2007 File Formats SP1 and SP2, Expression Web, Expression
Web 2, Groove 2007 Gold and SP1, Works 8.5, SQL Server 2000 Reporting
Services SP2, SQL Server 2005 SP2 and SP3, Report Viewer 2005 SP1,
Report Viewer 2008 Gold and SP1, and Forefront Client Security 1.0
allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code via a crafted TIFF
image file, aka "GDI+ TIFF Buffer Overflow Vulnerability."


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)


======================================================
Name: CVE-2009-2503
Status: Candidate

Reference: OVAL:oval:org.mitre.oval:def:6491

GDI+ in Microsoft Internet Explorer 6 SP1, Windows XP SP2 and SP3,
Windows Server 2003 SP2, Office XP SP3, Office 2003 SP3, 2007
Microsoft Office System SP1 and SP2, Office Project 2002 SP1, Visio
2002 SP2, Office Word Viewer, Word Viewer 2003 Gold and SP3, Office
Excel Viewer 2003 Gold and SP3, Office Excel Viewer, Office PowerPoint
Viewer 2007 Gold, SP1, and SP2, Office Compatibility Pack for Word,
Excel, and PowerPoint 2007 File Formats SP1 and SP2, Expression Web,
Expression Web 2, Groove 2007 Gold and SP1, Works 8.5, SQL Server 2000
Reporting Services SP2, SQL Server 2005 SP2 and SP3, Report Viewer
2005 SP1, Report Viewer 2008 Gold and SP1, and Forefront Client
Security 1.0 does not properly allocate an unspecified buffer, which
allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code via a crafted TIFF
image file that triggers memory corruption, aka "GDI+ TIFF Memory
Corruption Vulnerability."

======================================================
Name: CVE-2009-2510
Status: Candidate
URL: http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2009-2510
Phase: Assigned (20090717)
Category: 
Reference: MISC:http://www.networkworld.com/news/2009/073009-more-holes-found-in-webs.html
Reference: MISC:http://www.networkworld.com/news/2009/091709-microsoft-ie-security-hole.html
Reference: MISC:http://www.wired.com/threatlevel/2009/07/kaminsky/
Reference: MS:MS09-056
Reference: URL:http://www.microsoft.com/technet/security/Bulletin/MS09-056.mspx
Reference: CERT:TA09-286A
Reference: URL:http://www.us-cert.gov/cas/techalerts/TA09-286A.html
Reference: BID:36475
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/36475
Reference: OVAL:oval:org.mitre.oval:def:5842
Reference: URL:http://oval.mitre.org/repository/data/getDef?id=oval:org.mitre.oval:def:5842

The CryptoAPI component in Microsoft Windows 2000 SP4, Windows XP SP2
and SP3, Windows Server 2003 SP2, Windows Vista Gold, SP1, and SP2,
Windows Server 2008 Gold, SP2, and R2, and Windows 7, as used by
Internet Explorer and other applications, does not properly handle a
'\0' character in a domain name in the subject's Common Name (CN)
field of an X.509 certificate, which allows man-in-the-middle
attackers to spoof arbitrary SSL servers via a crafted certificate
issued by a legitimate Certification Authority, aka "Null Truncation
in X.509 Common Name Vulnerability," a related issue to CVE-2009-2408.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)

======================================================
Name: CVE-2009-3672
Status: Candidate
URL: http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2009-3672
Phase: Assigned (20091013)
Category: 
Reference: BUGTRAQ:20091120 IE7
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/archive/1/archive/1/507984/100/0/threaded
Reference: MISC:http://www.symantec.com/connect/blogs/zero-day-internet-explorer-exploit-published
Reference: CONFIRM:http://www.microsoft.com/technet/security/advisory/977981.mspx
Reference: MS:MS09-072
Reference: URL:http://www.microsoft.com/technet/security/Bulletin/MS09-072.mspx
Reference: CERT:TA09-342A
Reference: URL:http://www.us-cert.gov/cas/techalerts/TA09-342A.html
Reference: CERT-VN:VU#515749
Reference: URL:http://www.kb.cert.org/vuls/id/515749
Reference: BID:37085
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/37085
Reference: OVAL:oval:org.mitre.oval:def:6381
Reference: URL:http://oval.mitre.org/repository/data/getDef?id=oval:org.mitre.oval:def:6381
Reference: SECTRACK:1023293
Reference: URL:http://www.securitytracker.com/id?1023293
Reference: SECUNIA:37448
Reference: URL:http://secunia.com/advisories/37448
Reference: VUPEN:ADV-2009-3301
Reference: URL:http://www.vupen.com/english/advisories/2009/3301

Microsoft Internet Explorer 6 and 7 does not properly handle objects
in memory that (1) were not properly initialized or (2) are deleted,
which allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code via vectors
involving a call to the getElementsByTagName method for the STYLE tag
name, selection of the single element in the returned list, and a
change to the outerHTML property of this element, related to Cascading
Style Sheets (CSS) and mshtml.dll, aka "HTML Object Memory Corruption
Vulnerability." NOTE: some of these details are obtained from third
party information. NOTE: this issue was originally assigned
CVE-2009-4054, but Microsoft assigned a duplicate identifier of
CVE-2009-3672. CVE consumers should use this identifier instead of
CVE-2009-4054.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)


======================================================
Name: CVE-2009-3673
Status: Candidate

Microsoft Internet Explorer 7 and 8 does not properly handle objects
in memory, which allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code by
accessing an object that (1) was not properly initialized or (2) is
deleted, leading to memory corruption, aka "Uninitialized Memory
Corruption Vulnerability."

Incomplete blacklist vulnerability in browser/download/download_exe.cc
in Google Chrome before 3.0.195.32 allows remote attackers to force
the download of certain dangerous files via a "Content-Disposition:
attachment" designation, as demonstrated by (1) .mht and (2) .mhtml
files, which are automatically executed by Internet Explorer 6; (3)
.svg files, which are automatically executed by Safari; (4) .xml
files; (5) .htt files; (6) .xsl files; (7) .xslt files; and (8) image
files that are forbidden by the victim's site policy.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2009-3977

Reference: URL:http://xforce.iss.net/xforce/xfdb/54377

Multiple buffer overflows in a certain ActiveX control in
ActiveDom.ocx in HP OpenView Network Node Manager (OV NNM) 7.53 might
allow remote attackers to cause a denial of service (memory
corruption) or have unspecified other impact via a long string
argument to the (1) DisplayName, (2) AddGroup, (3) InstallComponent,
or (4) Subscribe method.  NOTE: this issue is not a vulnerability in
many environments, because the control is not marked as safe for
scripting and would not execute with default Internet Explorer
settings.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2009-4074
Status: Candidate
URL: http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2009-4074
Phase: Assigned (20091125)
Category: 
Reference: MISC:http://hackademix.net/2009/11/21/ies-xss-filter-creates-xss-vulnerabilities/
Reference: MISC:http://www.owasp.org/images/5/50/OWASP-Italy_Day_IV_Maone.pdf
Reference: MISC:http://www.theregister.co.uk/2009/11/20/internet_explorer_security_flaw/
Reference: MS:MS10-002
Reference: URL:http://www.microsoft.com/technet/security/Bulletin/MS10-002.mspx
Reference: BID:37135
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/37135
Reference: OVAL:oval:org.mitre.oval:def:7715
Reference: URL:http://oval.mitre.org/repository/data/getDef?id=oval:org.mitre.oval:def:7715

The XSS Filter in Microsoft Internet Explorer 8 allows remote
attackers to leverage the "response-changing mechanism" to conduct
cross-site scripting (XSS) attacks against web sites that have no
inherent XSS vulnerabilities, related to the details of output
encoding and improper modification of an HTML attribute, aka "XSS
Filter Script Handling Vulnerability."


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)


======================================================
Name: CVE-2009-4459
Status: Candidate
URL: http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2009-4459
Phase: Assigned (20091230)
Category: 
Reference: EXPLOIT-DB:10554
Reference: URL:http://www.exploit-db.com/exploits/10554
Reference: BID:37425
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/37425
Reference: XF:redmine-title-xss(54947)
Reference: URL:http://xforce.iss.net/xforce/xfdb/54947

Redmine 0.8.7 and earlier uses the title tag before defining the
character encoding in a meta tag, which allows remote attackers to
conduct cross-site scripting (XSS) attacks and inject arbitrary script
via UTF-7 encoded values in the title parameter to a new issue page,
which may be interpreted as script by Internet Explorer 7 and 8.

before 2.0.4, executes a mail application in situations where an IMG
element has a SRC attribute that is a redirect to a mailto: URL, which
allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (excessive
application launches) via an HTML document with many images.

Status: Candidate
URL: http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2010-0255
Phase: Assigned (20100107)
Category: 
Reference: BUGTRAQ:20100203 CORE-2009-0625: Internet Explorer Dynamic OBJECT tag and URLMON sniffing vulnerabilities
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/archive/1/archive/1/509345/100/0/threaded
Reference: MISC:http://isc.sans.org/diary.html?n&storyid=8152
Reference: MISC:http://www.coresecurity.com/content/internet-explorer-dynamic-object-tag
Reference: CONFIRM:http://blogs.technet.com/msrc/archive/2010/02/03/security-advisory-980088-released.aspx
Reference: CONFIRM:http://www.microsoft.com/technet/security/advisory/980088.mspx
Reference: CONFIRM:http://support.avaya.com/css/P8/documents/100089747
Reference: MS:MS10-035
Reference: URL:http://www.microsoft.com/technet/security/bulletin/ms10-035.mspx
Reference: CERT:TA10-159B
Reference: URL:http://www.us-cert.gov/cas/techalerts/TA10-159B.html
Reference: BID:38055
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/38055
Reference: BID:38056
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/38056
Reference: OSVDB:62156
Reference: URL:http://osvdb.org/62156
Reference: OVAL:oval:org.mitre.oval:def:7145
Reference: URL:http://oval.mitre.org/repository/data/getDef?id=oval:org.mitre.oval:def:7145

Microsoft Internet Explorer 5.01 SP4, 6, 6 SP1, 7, and 8 does not
prevent rendering of non-HTML local files as HTML documents, which
allows remote attackers to bypass intended access restrictions and
read arbitrary files via vectors involving JavaScript exploit code
that constructs a reference to a file://127.0.0.1 URL, aka the dynamic
OBJECT tag vulnerability, as demonstrated by obtaining the data from
an index.dat file, a variant of CVE-2009-1140 and related to
CVE-2008-1448.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2010-0267
Status: Candidate
URL: http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2010-0267
Phase: Assigned (20100107)
Category: 
Reference: MS:MS10-018
Reference: URL:http://www.microsoft.com/technet/security/Bulletin/MS10-018.mspx
Reference: CERT:TA10-068A
Reference: URL:http://www.us-cert.gov/cas/techalerts/TA10-068A.html
Reference: CERT:TA10-089A
Reference: URL:http://www.us-cert.gov/cas/techalerts/TA10-089A.html
Reference: BID:39023
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/39023
Reference: OVAL:oval:org.mitre.oval:def:8554
Reference: URL:http://oval.mitre.org/repository/data/getDef?id=oval:org.mitre.oval:def:8554
Reference: SECTRACK:1023773
Reference: URL:http://securitytracker.com/id?1023773
Reference: VUPEN:ADV-2010-0744
Reference: URL:http://www.vupen.com/english/advisories/2010/0744

Microsoft Internet Explorer 6, 6 SP1, and 7 does not properly handle
objects in memory, which allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary
code by accessing an object that (1) was not properly initialized or
(2) is deleted, leading to memory corruption, aka "Uninitialized
Memory Corruption Vulnerability."

None (candidate not yet proposed)

Name: CVE-2010-0483
Status: Candidate
URL: http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2010-0483
Phase: Assigned (20100202)
Category: 
Reference: MISC:http://isec.pl/vulnerabilities/isec-0027-msgbox-helpfile-ie.txt
Reference: MISC:http://isec.pl/vulnerabilities10.html
Reference: MISC:http://www.computerworld.com/s/article/9163298/New_zero_day_involves_IE_puts_Windows_XP_users_at_risk

Reference: MISC:https://www.metasploit.com/svn/framework3/trunk/modules/exploits/windows/browser/ie_winhlp32.rb
Reference: CONFIRM:http://blogs.technet.com/msrc/archive/2010/02/28/investigating-a-new-win32hlp-and-internet-explorer-issue.aspx
Reference: CONFIRM:http://blogs.technet.com/msrc/archive/2010/03/01/security-advisory-981169-released.aspx
Reference: CONFIRM:http://blogs.technet.com/srd/archive/2010/03/01/help-keypress-vulnerability-in-vbscript-enabling-remote-code-execution.aspx

Reference: MS:MS10-022
Reference: URL:http://www.microsoft.com/technet/security/Bulletin/MS10-022.mspx
Reference: CERT:TA10-103A
Reference: URL:http://www.us-cert.gov/cas/techalerts/TA10-103A.html
Reference: CERT-VN:VU#612021
Reference: URL:http://www.kb.cert.org/vuls/id/612021
Reference: BID:38463
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/38463
Reference: OSVDB:62632
Reference: URL:http://www.osvdb.org/62632
Reference: OVAL:oval:org.mitre.oval:def:7170
Reference: URL:http://oval.mitre.org/repository/data/getDef?id=oval:org.mitre.oval:def:7170
Reference: OVAL:oval:org.mitre.oval:def:8654
Reference: URL:http://oval.mitre.org/repository/data/getDef?id=oval:org.mitre.oval:def:8654
Reference: SECTRACK:1023668
Reference: URL:http://securitytracker.com/id?1023668
Reference: SECUNIA:38727
Reference: URL:http://secunia.com/advisories/38727
Reference: VUPEN:ADV-2010-0485
Reference: URL:http://www.vupen.com/english/advisories/2010/0485
Reference: XF:ms-win-msgbox-code-execution(56558)
Reference: URL:http://xforce.iss.net/xforce/xfdb/56558

vbscript.dll in VBScript 5.1, 5.6, 5.7, and 5.8 in Microsoft Windows
2000 SP4, XP SP2 and SP3, and Server 2003 SP2, when Internet Explorer
is used, allows user-assisted remote attackers to execute arbitrary
code by referencing a (1) local pathname, (2) UNC share pathname, or
(3) WebDAV server with a crafted .hlp file in the fourth argument (aka
helpfile argument) to the MsgBox function, leading to code execution
involving winhlp32.exe when the F1 key is pressed, aka "VBScript Help
Keypress Vulnerability."


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)

Name: CVE-2010-0555
Status: Candidate
URL: http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2010-0555
Phase: Assigned (20100204)
Category: 
Reference: BUGTRAQ:20100203 CORE-2009-0625: Internet Explorer Dynamic OBJECT tag and URLMON sniffing vulnerabilities
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/archive/1/archive/1/509345/100/0/threaded
Reference: MISC:http://blogs.technet.com/msrc/archive/2010/02/03/security-advisory-980088-released.aspx
Reference: MISC:http://isc.sans.org/diary.html?n&storyid=8152
Reference: MISC:http://www.coresecurity.com/content/internet-explorer-dynamic-object-tag
Reference: MISC:http://www.microsoft.com/technet/security/advisory/980088.mspx
Reference: BID:38055
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/38055
Reference: BID:38056
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/38056
Reference: OSVDB:62157
Reference: URL:http://osvdb.org/62157

Microsoft Internet Explorer 5.01 SP4, 6, 6 SP1, 7, and 8 does not
prevent rendering of non-HTML local files as HTML documents, which
allows remote attackers to bypass intended access restrictions and
read arbitrary files via vectors involving the product's use of
text/html as the default content type for files that are encountered
after a redirection, aka the URLMON sniffing vulnerability, a variant
of CVE-2009-1140 and related to CVE-2008-1448.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)

Category: 
Reference: MISC:http://code.google.com/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=9877

Microsoft Internet Explorer permits cross-origin loading of CSS
stylesheets even when the stylesheet download has an incorrect MIME
type and the stylesheet document is malformed, which allows remote
HTTP servers to obtain sensitive information via a crafted document.

Explorer 5.01 SP4, 6 on Windows XP SP2 and SP3, and 6 SP1 allows
remote attackers to execute arbitrary code via a long URL (DataURL
parameter) that triggers memory corruption in the
CTDCCtl::SecurityCHeckDataURL function, aka "Memory Corruption
Vulnerability."

======================================================
Name: CVE-2010-0814
Status: Candidate
URL: http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2010-0814
Phase: Assigned (20100302)
Category: 
Reference: MS:MS10-044
Reference: URL:http://www.microsoft.com/technet/security/Bulletin/MS10-044.mspx

The Microsoft Access Wizard Controls in ACCWIZ.dll in Microsoft Office
Access 2003 SP3 and 2007 SP1 and SP2 do not properly interact with the
memory-allocation approach used by Internet Explorer during
instantiation, which allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code
via a web site that references multiple ActiveX controls, as
demonstrated by the ImexGrid and FieldList controls, aka "Access
ActiveX Control Vulnerability."

might allow user-assisted remote attackers to execute arbitrary code

the MsgBox function, leading to code execution when the F1 key is

Category: 
Reference: MISC:http://code.google.com/p/skylined/issues/detail?id=3
Reference: MISC:http://skypher.com/index.php/2010/03/08/ani-file-bitmapinfoheader-biclrused-bounds-check-missing/
Reference: BID:38579
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/38579
Reference: XF:microsoft-windows-ani-dos(56756)
Reference: URL:http://xforce.iss.net/xforce/xfdb/56756

The ANI parser in Microsoft Windows before 7 on the x86 platform, as
used in Internet Explorer and other applications, allows remote
attackers to cause a denial of service (memory and CPU consumption)
via a crafted biClrUsed value in the BITMAPINFO header of a .ANI file.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)

vectors, as demonstrated by Peter Vreugdenhil during a Pwn2Own
competition at CanSecWest 2010.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2010-1127
Status: Candidate
URL: http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2010-1127
Phase: Assigned (20100326)
Category: 
Reference: BUGTRAQ:20100126 Microsoft IE 6&7 Crash Exploit

Reference: URL:http://archives.neohapsis.com/archives/bugtraq/2010-01/0278.html
Reference: MISC:http://securityreason.com/exploitalert/7731

Microsoft Internet Explorer 6 and 7 does not initialize certain data
structures during execution of the createElement method, which allows
remote attackers to cause a denial of service (NULL pointer
dereference and application crash) via crafted JavaScript code, as
demonstrated by setting the (1) outerHTML or (2) value property of an
object returned by createElement.

in ACCWIZ.dll in Microsoft Office Access 2003 SP3 does not properly
interact with the memory-access approach used by Internet Explorer and
Office during instantiation, which allows remote attackers to execute
arbitrary code or cause a denial of service (memory corruption) via an
HTML document that references this control along with crafted
persistent storage data, aka "ACCWIZ.dll Uninitialized Variable
Vulnerability."

Reference: URL:http://xforce.iss.net/xforce/xfdb/59517

when Internet Explorer is used, allows remote attackers to inject
arbitrary web script or HTML via the HTTP Referer in a "404 Not Found"
response.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2010-3886
Status: Candidate
URL: http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2010-3886
Phase: Assigned (20101008)
Category: 
Reference: BUGTRAQ:20100629 [0day] Microsoft mshtml.dll CTimeoutEventList::InsertIntoTimeoutList memory leak
Reference: URL:http://archives.neohapsis.com/archives/bugtraq/2010-06/0259.html
Reference: MISC:http://twitter.com/WisecWisec/statuses/17254776077
Reference: MISC:http://www.eeye.com/Resources/Security-Center/Research/Zero-Day-Tracker/2010/20100630
Reference: OVAL:oval:org.mitre.oval:def:11606
Reference: URL:http://oval.mitre.org/repository/data/getDef?id=oval:org.mitre.oval:def:11606

The CTimeoutEventList::InsertIntoTimeoutList function in Microsoft
mshtml.dll uses a certain pointer value as part of producing Timer ID
values for the setTimeout and setInterval methods in VBScript and
JScript, which allows remote attackers to obtain sensitive information
about the heap memory addresses used by an application, as
demonstrated by the Internet Explorer 8 application.

None (candidate not yet proposed)

Reference: OVAL:oval:org.mitre.oval:def:12382

Reference: VUPEN:ADV-2011-0318
Reference: URL:http://www.vupen.com/english/advisories/2011/0318

Use-after-free vulnerability in the CSharedStyleSheet::Notify function
in the Cascading Style Sheets (CSS) parser in mshtml.dll, as used in
Microsoft Internet Explorer 6 through 8 and other products, allows
remote attackers to execute arbitrary code or cause a denial of
service (application crash) via a self-referential @import rule in a
stylesheet, aka "CSS Memory Corruption Vulnerability."

Name: CVE-2011-1255
Status: Candidate
URL: http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2011-1255
Phase: Assigned (20110304)
Category: 
Reference: CONFIRM:http://blogs.technet.com/b/srd/archive/2011/06/14/ms11-050-ie9-is-better.aspx

Reference: URL:http://www.microsoft.com/technet/security/Bulletin/MS11-050.mspx

Reference: URL:http://osvdb.org/72947
Reference: OVAL:oval:org.mitre.oval:def:12227
Reference: URL:http://oval.mitre.org/repository/data/getDef?id=oval:org.mitre.oval:def:12227

The Timed Interactive Multimedia Extensions (aka HTML+TIME)
implementation in Microsoft Internet Explorer 6 through 8 does not
properly handle objects in memory, which allows remote attackers to
execute arbitrary code by accessing an object that (1) was not
properly initialized or (2) is deleted, aka "Time Element Memory
Corruption Vulnerability."


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)

======================================================
Name: CVE-2011-1398
Status: Candidate
URL: http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2011-1398
Phase: Assigned (20110310)
Category: 
Reference: MLIST:[internals] 20120203 [PHP-DEV] The case of HTTP response splitting protection in PHP
Reference: URL:http://article.gmane.org/gmane.comp.php.devel/70584
Reference: MLIST:[oss-security] 20120829 php header() header injection detection bypass
Reference: URL:http://openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2012/08/29/5
Reference: MLIST:[oss-security] 20120905 Re: php header() header injection detection bypass
Reference: URL:http://openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2012/09/05/15
Reference: MISC:https://bugs.php.net/bug.php?id=60227
Reference: CONFIRM:http://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2011-1398
Reference: REDHAT:RHSA-2013:1307
Reference: URL:http://rhn.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2013-1307.html
Reference: SUSE:SUSE-SU-2013:1315
Reference: URL:http://lists.opensuse.org/opensuse-security-announce/2013-08/msg00006.html
Reference: UBUNTU:USN-1569-1
Reference: URL:http://www.ubuntu.com/usn/USN-1569-1
Reference: SECTRACK:1027463
Reference: URL:http://www.securitytracker.com/id?1027463
Reference: SECUNIA:55078
Reference: URL:http://secunia.com/advisories/55078

The sapi_header_op function in main/SAPI.c in PHP before 5.3.11 and
5.4.x before 5.4.0RC2 does not check for %0D sequences (aka carriage
return characters), which allows remote attackers to bypass an HTTP
response-splitting protection mechanism via a crafted URL, related to
improper interaction between the PHP header function and certain
browsers, as demonstrated by Internet Explorer and Google Chrome.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)

Reference: URL:http://www.vupen.com/english/advisories/2011/0978

Reference: URL:http://www.vupen.com/english/advisories/2011/1100

Reference: XF:mediawiki-file-extensions-xss(66737)
Reference: URL:http://xforce.iss.net/xforce/xfdb/66737

Cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerability in MediaWiki before 1.16.3,
when Internet Explorer 6 or earlier is used, allows remote attackers
to inject arbitrary web script or HTML via an uploaded file accessed
with a dangerous extension such as .html at the end of the query
string, in conjunction with a modified URI path that has a %2E
sequence in place of the . (dot) character.

None (candidate not yet proposed)


======================================================
Name: CVE-2011-1587
Status: Candidate
URL: http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2011-1587
Phase: Assigned (20110405)
Category: 
Reference: MLIST:[mediawiki-announce] 20110414 MediaWiki security release 1.16.4
Reference: URL:http://lists.wikimedia.org/pipermail/mediawiki-announce/2011-April/000097.html
Reference: MLIST:[oss-security] 20110418 Re: CVE request: mediawiki 1.16.4, incomplete fix of CVE-2011-1578
Reference: URL:http://openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2011/04/18/5
Reference: CONFIRM:https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=696360
Reference: DEBIAN:DSA-2366
Reference: URL:http://www.debian.org/security/2011/dsa-2366

Cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerability in MediaWiki before 1.16.4,
when Internet Explorer 6 or earlier is used, allows remote attackers
to inject arbitrary web script or HTML via an uploaded file accessed
with a dangerous extension such as .html located before a ? (question
mark) in a query string, in conjunction with a modified URI path that
has a %2E sequence in place of the . (dot) character.  NOTE: this
vulnerability exists because of an incomplete fix for CVE-2011-1578.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)

======================================================
Name: CVE-2011-1894
Status: Candidate
URL: http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2011-1894
Phase: Assigned (20110504)
Category: 
Reference: MS:MS11-037
Reference: URL:http://www.microsoft.com/technet/security/Bulletin/MS11-037.mspx
Reference: BID:48205
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/48205
Reference: OVAL:oval:org.mitre.oval:def:12494
Reference: URL:http://oval.mitre.org/repository/data/getDef?id=oval:org.mitre.oval:def:12494
Reference: SECTRACK:1025655
Reference: URL:http://www.securitytracker.com/id?1025655

The MHTML protocol handler in Microsoft Windows XP SP2 and SP3,
Windows Server 2003 SP2, Windows Vista SP1 and SP2, Windows Server
2008 Gold, SP2, R2, and R2 SP1, and Windows 7 Gold and SP1 does not
properly handle a MIME format in a request for embedded content in an
HTML document, which allows remote attackers to conduct cross-site
scripting (XSS) attacks via a crafted EMBED element in a web page that
is visited in Internet Explorer, aka "MHTML Mime-Formatted Request
Vulnerability."

None (candidate not yet proposed)

Reference: URL:http://www.us-cert.gov/cas/techalerts/TA11-221A.html
Reference: OVAL:oval:org.mitre.oval:def:12617
Reference: URL:http://oval.mitre.org/repository/data/getDef?id=oval:org.mitre.oval:def:12617

Microsoft Internet Explorer 6 through 9 does not properly handle
objects in memory, which allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary
code by accessing an object that (1) was not properly initialized or
(2) is deleted, aka "Style Object Memory Corruption Vulnerability."


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)

======================================================
Name: CVE-2011-2382
Status: Candidate
URL: http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2011-2382
Phase: Assigned (20110603)
Category: 
Reference: MISC:http://conference.hackinthebox.org/hitbsecconf2011ams/?page_id=1388
Reference: MISC:http://ju12.tistory.com/attachment/cfile4.uf@151FAB4C4DDC9E0002A6FE.ppt
Reference: MISC:http://news.cnet.com/8301-1009_3-20066419-83.html
Reference: MISC:http://www.eweek.com/c/a/Security/IE-Flaw-Lets-Attackers-Steal-Cookies-Access-User-Accounts-402503/
Reference: MISC:http://www.informationweek.com/news/security/vulnerabilities/229700031
Reference: MISC:http://www.networkworld.com/community/node/74259
Reference: MISC:http://www.theregister.co.uk/2011/05/25/microsoft_internet_explorer_cookiejacking/
Reference: MISC:http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=V95CX-3JpK0
Reference: MISC:http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=VsSkcnIFCxM
Reference: MISC:https://sites.google.com/site/tentacoloviola/cookiejacking/Cookiejacking2011_final.ppt

Microsoft Internet Explorer 8 and earlier, and Internet Explorer 9
beta, does not properly restrict cross-zone drag-and-drop actions,
which allows user-assisted remote attackers to read cookie files via
vectors involving an IFRAME element with a SRC attribute containing a
file: URL, as demonstrated by a Facebook game, related to a
"cookiejacking" issue.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)

Name: CVE-2011-2383
Status: Candidate
URL: http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2011-2383
Phase: Assigned (20110603)
Category: 
Reference: MISC:http://conference.hackinthebox.org/hitbsecconf2011ams/?page_id=1388
Reference: MISC:http://ju12.tistory.com/attachment/cfile4.uf@151FAB4C4DDC9E0002A6FE.ppt
Reference: MISC:http://news.cnet.com/8301-1009_3-20066419-83.html
Reference: MISC:http://www.eweek.com/c/a/Security/IE-Flaw-Lets-Attackers-Steal-Cookies-Access-User-Accounts-402503/
Reference: MISC:http://www.informationweek.com/news/security/vulnerabilities/229700031
Reference: MISC:http://www.networkworld.com/community/node/74259
Reference: MISC:http://www.theregister.co.uk/2011/05/25/microsoft_internet_explorer_cookiejacking/
Reference: MISC:http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=V95CX-3JpK0
Reference: MISC:http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=VsSkcnIFCxM
Reference: MISC:https://sites.google.com/site/tentacoloviola/cookiejacking/Cookiejacking2011_final.ppt
Reference: MS:MS11-057
Reference: URL:http://www.microsoft.com/technet/security/Bulletin/MS11-057.mspx
Reference: OVAL:oval:org.mitre.oval:def:12820
Reference: URL:http://oval.mitre.org/repository/data/getDef?id=oval:org.mitre.oval:def:12820

Microsoft Internet Explorer 9 and earlier does not properly restrict
cross-zone drag-and-drop actions, which allows user-assisted remote
attackers to read cookie files via vectors involving an IFRAME element
with a SRC attribute containing an http: URL that redirects to a file:
URL, as demonstrated by a Facebook game, related to a "cookiejacking"
issue, aka "Drag and Drop Information Disclosure Vulnerability." NOTE:
this vulnerability exists because of an incomplete fix in the Internet
Explorer 9 release.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)

Name: CVE-2011-2710
Status: Candidate
URL: http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2011-2710
Phase: Assigned (20110711)
Category: 
Reference: MLIST:[oss-security] 20110722 CVE Request: Joomla! 1.7.0-RC and lower | Cross Site Scripting Vulnerabilities
Reference: URL:http://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2011/07/22/1
Reference: MLIST:[oss-security] 20110722 Re: CVE Request: Joomla! 1.7.0-RC and lower | Cross Site Scripting Vulnerabilities
Reference: URL:http://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2011/07/22/5
Reference: MLIST:[oss-security] 20111016 Duplicate CVE assigned: CVE-2011-2708 CVE-2011-2710
Reference: URL:http://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2011/10/16/1
Reference: MLIST:[oss-security] 20111121 Re: Fwd: XSS vulnerability in Joomla 1.6.3 - CVE-2011-2710 / CVE-2011-2708 issue
Reference: URL:http://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2011/11/21/27
Reference: MISC:http://yehg.net/lab/pr0js/advisories/joomla/core/[joomla_1.7.0-rc]_cross_site_scripting(XSS)
Reference: CONFIRM:http://developer.joomla.org/security/news/357-20110701-xss-vulnerability.html

Multiple cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerabilities in Joomla! before
1.7.0 allow remote attackers to inject arbitrary web script or HTML
via (1) the URI to includes/application.php, reachable through
index.php; and, when Internet Explorer or Konqueror is used, (2) allow
remote attackers to inject arbitrary web script or HTML via the
searchword parameter in a search action to index.php in the com_search
component.  NOTE: vector 2 exists because of an incomplete fix for
CVE-2011-2509.5.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)

The SSL protocol, as used in certain configurations in Microsoft
Windows and Microsoft Internet Explorer, Mozilla Firefox, Google
Chrome, Opera, and other products, encrypts data by using CBC mode
with chained initialization vectors, which allows man-in-the-middle
attackers to obtain plaintext HTTP headers via a blockwise
chosen-boundary attack (BCBA) on an HTTPS session, in conjunction with
JavaScript code that uses (1) the HTML5 WebSocket API, (2) the Java
URLConnection API, or (3) the Silverlight WebClient API, aka a "BEAST"
attack.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)


======================================================

and SP3 and Server 2003 SP2 allows remote attackers to execute

"binary behavior" in Internet Explorer, aka "Microsoft Time Remote
Code Execution Vulnerability."

Reference: OVAL:oval:org.mitre.oval:def:15530
Reference: URL:http://oval.mitre.org/repository/data/getDef?id=oval:org.mitre.oval:def:15530

The toStaticHTML API (aka the SafeHTML component) in Microsoft
Internet Explorer 8 and 9, Communicator 2007 R2, and Lync 2010 and
2010 Attendee does not properly handle event attributes and script,
which makes it easier for remote attackers to conduct cross-site
scripting (XSS) attacks via a crafted HTML document, aka "HTML
Sanitization Vulnerability."


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)

corruption) or possibly execute arbitrary code via a URI with a %
(percent) character as its (1) last or (2) second-to-last character.

The intu-help-qb (aka Intuit Help System Async Pluggable Protocol)
handlers in HelpAsyncPluggableProtocol.dll in Intuit QuickBooks 2009
through 2012, when Internet Explorer is used, might allow remote
attackers to obtain sensitive information via a URI with a % (percent)
character as its (1) last or (2) second-to-last character, in
situations where a certain "post-URL data" buffer contains a 0x0000
character but a buffer overflow does not occur.

arbitrary files in ZIP archives via a full pathname in the URI.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2012-2423

The intu-help-qb (aka Intuit Help System Async Pluggable Protocol)
handlers in HelpAsyncPluggableProtocol.dll in Intuit QuickBooks 2009
through 2012, when Internet Explorer is used, provide different
responses to remote requests depending on whether a ZIP pathname is
valid, which allows remote attackers to obtain potentially sensitive
information about the installation path and product version via a
series of requests involving the Msxml2.XMLHTTP object.

Phase: Assigned (20130122)
Category: 
Reference: MISC:http://www.nsfocus.com/en/2012/advisories_1228/119.html

Microsoft Internet Explorer before 10 allows remote attackers to
obtain sensitive information about the existence of files, and read
certain data from files, via a UNC share pathname in the SRC attribute
of a SCRIPT element, as demonstrated by reading a name-value pair from
a local file via a \\127.0.0.1\C$\ sequence.

"Shift JIS Character Encoding Vulnerability."

======================================================
Name: CVE-2013-1347
Status: Candidate
URL: http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2013-1347
Phase: Assigned (20130112)
Category: 
Reference: EXPLOIT-DB:25294
Reference: URL:http://www.exploit-db.com/exploits/25294
Reference: CONFIRM:http://technet.microsoft.com/security/advisory/2847140
Reference: MS:MS13-038
Reference: URL:http://technet.microsoft.com/security/bulletin/MS13-038
Reference: CERT:TA13-134A
Reference: URL:http://www.us-cert.gov/ncas/alerts/TA13-134A

Microsoft Internet Explorer 8 does not properly handle objects in
memory, which allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code by
accessing an object that (1) was not properly allocated or (2) is
deleted, as exploited in the wild in May 2013.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)


======================================================
Name: CVE-2013-1450
Status: Candidate
URL: http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2013-1450
Phase: Assigned (20130128)
Category: 
Reference: MISC:http://pastebin.com/raw.php?i=rz9BcBey
Reference: MISC:http://www.youtube.com/ChristianHaiderPoC
Reference: MISC:http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=TPqagWAvo8U

Microsoft Internet Explorer 8 and 9, when the Proxy Settings
configuration has the same Proxy address and Port values in the HTTP
and Secure rows, does not properly reuse TCP sessions to the proxy
server, which allows remote attackers to obtain sensitive information
intended for a specific host via a crafted HTML document that triggers
many HTTPS requests and then triggers an HTTP request to that host, as
demonstrated by reading a Cookie header, aka MSRC 12096gd.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)


======================================================
Name: CVE-2013-1451
Status: Candidate
URL: http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2013-1451
Phase: Assigned (20130128)
Category: 
Reference: MISC:http://pastebin.com/raw.php?i=rz9BcBey
Reference: MISC:http://www.youtube.com/ChristianHaiderPoC
Reference: MISC:http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=TPqagWAvo8U

Microsoft Internet Explorer 8 and 9, when the Proxy Settings
configuration has the same Proxy address and Port values in the HTTP
and Secure rows, does not ensure that the SSL lock icon is consistent
with the Address bar, which makes it easier for remote attackers to
spoof web sites via a crafted HTML document that triggers many HTTPS
requests to an arbitrary host, followed by an HTTPS request to a
trusted host and then an HTTP request to an untrusted host, a related
issue to CVE-2013-1450.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)

Unspecified vulnerability in the Java Runtime Environment (JRE)
component in Oracle Java SE 7 Update 10 and Update 11, when running on
Windows using Internet Explorer, Firefox, Opera, and Google Chrome,
allows remote attackers to bypass the "Very High" security level of
the Java Control Panel and execute unsigned Java code without
prompting the user via unknown vectors, aka "Issue 53" and the "Java
Security Slider" vulnerability.

Status: Candidate
URL: http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2013-3115
Phase: Assigned (20130417)
Category: 
Reference: MS:MS13-055
Reference: URL:http://technet.microsoft.com/security/bulletin/MS13-055
Reference: CERT:TA13-190A
Reference: URL:http://www.us-cert.gov/ncas/alerts/TA13-190A
Reference: OVAL:oval:org.mitre.oval:def:17190
Reference: URL:http://oval.mitre.org/repository/data/getDef?id=oval:org.mitre.oval:def:17190

Microsoft Internet Explorer 7 through 10 allows remote attackers to
execute arbitrary code or cause a denial of service (memory
corruption) via a crafted web site, aka "Internet Explorer Memory
Corruption Vulnerability," a different vulnerability than
CVE-2013-3162.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)

======================================================
Name: CVE-2013-3126
Status: Candidate
URL: http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2013-3126
Phase: Assigned (20130417)
Category: 
Reference: MS:MS13-047
Reference: URL:http://technet.microsoft.com/security/bulletin/MS13-047
Reference: OVAL:oval:org.mitre.oval:def:16687
Reference: URL:http://oval.mitre.org/repository/data/getDef?id=oval:org.mitre.oval:def:16687

Microsoft Internet Explorer 9 and 10, when script debugging is
enabled, does not properly handle objects in memory during the
processing of script, which allows remote attackers to execute
arbitrary code via a crafted web site, aka "Internet Explorer Script
Debug Vulnerability."

corruption) via a crafted web site, aka "Internet Explorer Memory

======================================================
Name: CVE-2013-3186
Status: Candidate
URL: http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2013-3186
Phase: Assigned (20130417)
Category: 
Reference: MS:MS13-059
Reference: URL:http://technet.microsoft.com/security/bulletin/MS13-059
Reference: OVAL:oval:org.mitre.oval:def:18031
Reference: URL:http://oval.mitre.org/repository/data/getDef?id=oval:org.mitre.oval:def:18031

The Protected Mode feature in Microsoft Internet Explorer 7 through 10
on Windows Vista SP2, Windows Server 2008 SP2 and R2 SP1, Windows 7
SP1, Windows 8, Windows Server 2012, and Windows RT does not properly
implement the Integrity Access Level (aka IL) protection mechanism,
which allows remote attackers to obtain medium-integrity privileges by
leveraging access to a low-integrity process, aka "Process Integrity
Level Assignment Vulnerability."


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)

remote attackers to conduct cross-site scripting (XSS) attacks via
certain non-ASCII characters in CSS, as demonstrated using variations
of "expression" containing (1) full width characters or (2) IPA
extensions, which are converted and rendered by Internet Explorer.

implement the ASLR protection mechanism, which makes it easier for
remote attackers to execute arbitrary code via a crafted COM component
on a web site that is visited with Internet Explorer, as exploited in
the wild in December 2013, aka "HXDS ASLR Vulnerability."

======================================================
Name: CVE-2014-0235
Status: Candidate
URL: http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2014-0235
Phase: Assigned (20131203)
Category: 

** REJECT **

DO NOT USE THIS CANDIDATE NUMBER.  ConsultIDs: CVE-2014-0325,
CVE-2014-3538.  Reason: This candidate is a duplicate of CVE-2014-0325
and/or CVE-2014-3538.  A typo caused the wrong ID to be used.  Notes:
All CVE users should reference CVE-2014-0325 instead of this candidate
for the issue in the Internet Explorer product, and should reference
CVE-2014-3538 instead of this candidate for the issue in the file
product.  All references and descriptions in this candidate have been
removed to prevent accidental usage.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)

2008 R2 SP1, Windows 8, Windows 8.1, Windows Server 2012 Gold and R2,
and Windows RT Gold and 8.1 allows remote attackers to execute
arbitrary code via a large 2D geometric figure that is encountered
with Internet Explorer, aka "Microsoft Graphics Component Memory
Corruption Vulnerability."

======================================================
Name: CVE-2014-1771
Status: Candidate
URL: http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2014-1771
Phase: Assigned (20140129)
Category: 
Reference: MISC:https://secure-resumption.com/
Reference: MS:MS14-035
Reference: URL:http://technet.microsoft.com/security/bulletin/MS14-035
Reference: BID:67861
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/67861
Reference: SECTRACK:1030370
Reference: URL:http://www.securitytracker.com/id/1030370

SChannel in Microsoft Internet Explorer 6 through 11 does not ensure
that a server's X.509 certificate is the same during renegotiation as
it was before renegotiation, which allows man-in-the-middle attackers
to obtain sensitive information or modify TLS session data via a
"triple handshake attack," aka "TLS Server Certificate Renegotiation
Vulnerability."


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)

======================================================
Name: CVE-2014-1776
Status: Candidate
URL: http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2014-1776
Phase: Assigned (20140129)
Category: 
Reference: MISC:http://www.fireeye.com/blog/uncategorized/2014/04/new-zero-day-exploit-targeting-internet-explorer-versions-9-through-11-identified-in-targeted-attacks.html
Reference: MISC:http://www.signalsec.com/cve-2014-1776-ie-0day-analysis/
Reference: CONFIRM:https://technet.microsoft.com/library/security/2963983
Reference: CONFIRM:http://blogs.technet.com/b/srd/archive/2014/04/30/protection-strategies-for-the-security-advisory-2963983-ie-0day.aspx
Reference: MS:MS14-021
Reference: URL:http://technet.microsoft.com/security/bulletin/MS14-021
Reference: CERT-VN:VU#222929
Reference: URL:http://www.kb.cert.org/vuls/id/222929
Reference: BID:67075
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/67075
Reference: OSVDB:106311
Reference: URL:http://www.osvdb.org/106311
Reference: SECTRACK:1030154
Reference: URL:http://securitytracker.com/id?1030154
Reference: SECUNIA:57908
Reference: URL:http://secunia.com/advisories/57908

Use-after-free vulnerability in Microsoft Internet Explorer 6 through
11 allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code or cause a denial
of service (memory corruption) via vectors related to the
CMarkup::IsConnectedToPrimaryMarkup function, as exploited in the wild
in April 2014.  NOTE: this issue originally emphasized VGX.DLL, but
Microsoft clarified that "VGX.DLL does not contain the vulnerable code
leveraged in this exploit. Disabling VGX.DLL is an exploit-specific
workaround that provides an immediate, effective workaround to help
block known attacks."


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)

Microsoft Internet Explorer 6 through 11 allows remote attackers to
execute arbitrary code or cause a denial of service (memory
corruption) via a crafted web site, as exploited in the wild in May
2014, aka "Internet Explorer Memory Corruption Vulnerability," a
different vulnerability than CVE-2014-0310.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)


======================================================
Name: CVE-2014-1816
Status: Candidate
URL: http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2014-1816
Phase: Assigned (20140129)
Category: 
Reference: CONFIRM:http://blogs.technet.com/b/srd/archive/2014/06/10/assessing-risk-for-the-june-2014-security-updates.aspx
Reference: MS:MS14-033
Reference: URL:http://technet.microsoft.com/security/bulletin/MS14-033
Reference: BID:67895
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/67895
Reference: SECUNIA:58538
Reference: URL:http://secunia.com/advisories/58538

Microsoft XML Core Services (aka MSXML) 3.0 and 6.0 does not properly
restrict the information transmitted by Internet Explorer during a
download action, which allows remote attackers to discover (1) full
pathnames on the client system and (2) local usernames embedded in
these pathnames via a crafted web site, aka "MSXML Entity URI
Vulnerability."


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)

======================================================
Name: CVE-2014-2783
Status: Candidate
URL: http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2014-2783
Phase: Assigned (20140410)
Category: 
Reference: MS:MS14-037
Reference: URL:http://technet.microsoft.com/security/bulletin/MS14-037
Reference: BID:68391
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/68391
Reference: SECTRACK:1030532
Reference: URL:http://www.securitytracker.com/id/1030532
Reference: SECUNIA:59775
Reference: URL:http://secunia.com/advisories/59775

Microsoft Internet Explorer 7 through 11 does not prevent use of
wildcard EV SSL certificates, which might allow remote attackers to
spoof a trust level by leveraging improper issuance of a wildcard
certificate by a recognized Certification Authority, aka "Extended
Validation (EV) Certificate Security Feature Bypass Vulnerability."

======================================================
Name: CVE-2014-2784
Status: Candidate
URL: http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2014-2784
Phase: Assigned (20140410)
Category: 
Reference: MS:MS14-051
Reference: URL:http://technet.microsoft.com/security/bulletin/MS14-051
Reference: BID:69100
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/69100

======================================================
Name: CVE-2014-4073
Status: Candidate
URL: http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2014-4073
Phase: Assigned (20140612)
Category: 
Reference: CONFIRM:http://blogs.technet.com/b/srd/archive/2014/10/14/more-details-about-cve-2014-4073-elevation-of-privilege-vulnerability.aspx
Reference: MS:MS14-057
Reference: URL:http://technet.microsoft.com/security/bulletin/MS14-057
Reference: BID:70313
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/70313
Reference: SECTRACK:1031021
Reference: URL:http://www.securitytracker.com/id/1031021
Reference: SECUNIA:60969
Reference: URL:http://secunia.com/advisories/60969

Microsoft .NET Framework 2.0 SP2, 3.5, 3.5.1, 4, 4.5, 4.5.1, and 4.5.2
processes unverified data during interaction with the ClickOnce
installer, which allows remote attackers to gain privileges via
vectors involving Internet Explorer, aka ".NET ClickOnce Elevation of
Privilege Vulnerability."

None (candidate not yet proposed)

CVE-2014-4108, CVE-2014-4109, CVE-2014-4110, and CVE-2014-4111.

execute arbitrary code or cause a denial of service (memory
corruption) via a crafted web site, aka "Internet Explorer Memory
Corruption Vulnerability," a different vulnerability than
CVE-2015-0020, CVE-2015-0022, CVE-2015-0026, CVE-2015-0030,
CVE-2015-0031, CVE-2015-0036, and CVE-2015-0041.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2015-0072
Status: Candidate
URL: http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2015-0072
Phase: Assigned (20141118)
Category: 
Reference: BUGTRAQ:20150209 Cookie hijacking: Internet Explorer UXSS (CVE-2015-0072)
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/archive/1/archive/1/534662/100/0/threaded
Reference: FULLDISC:20150131 Major Internet Explorer Vulnerability - NOT Patched
Reference: URL:http://seclists.org/fulldisclosure/2015/Feb/0
Reference: MISC:http://community.websense.com/blogs/securitylabs/archive/2015/02/05/another-day-another-zero-day-internet-explorer-s-turn-cve-2015-0072.aspx
Reference: MISC:http://innerht.ml/blog/ie-uxss.html
Reference: MISC:http://packetstormsecurity.com/files/130308/Microsoft-Internet-Explorer-Universal-XSS-Proof-Of-Concept.html
Reference: MISC:http://www.pcworld.com/article/2879372/dangerous-ie-vulnerability-opens-door-to-powerful-phishing-attacks.html
Reference: MISC:https://nakedsecurity.sophos.com/2015/02/04/internet-explorer-has-a-cross-site-scripting-zero-day-bug/
Reference: MS:MS15-018
Reference: URL:http://technet.microsoft.com/security/bulletin/MS15-018
Reference: BID:72489
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/72489
Reference: SECTRACK:1031888
Reference: URL:http://www.securitytracker.com/id/1031888
Reference: SECUNIA:62658
Reference: URL:http://secunia.com/advisories/62658
Reference: XF:ms-ie-cve20150072-xss(100606)
Reference: URL:http://xforce.iss.net/xforce/xfdb/100606

Cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerability in Microsoft Internet
Explorer 9 through 11 allows remote attackers to bypass the Same
Origin Policy and inject arbitrary web script or HTML via vectors
involving an IFRAME element that triggers a redirect, a second IFRAME
element that does not trigger a redirect, and an eval of a WindowProxy
object, aka "Universal XSS (UXSS)."


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)

RT Gold and 8.1 allows user-assisted remote attackers to execute
arbitrary code via a crafted web site that is accessed with the F12

Control Use After Free Vulnerability."

URL: http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2015-2484
Phase: Assigned (20150319)
Category: 
Reference: MS:MS15-094
Reference: URL:http://technet.microsoft.com/security/bulletin/MS15-094

Microsoft Internet Explorer 10 and 11 uses an incorrect flag during
certain filesystem accesses, which allows remote attackers to delete
arbitrary files via unspecified vectors, aka "Tampering
Vulnerability."


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)

through 18.x before 18.0.0.160 on Windows and OS X and before
11.2.202.466 on Linux, Adobe AIR before 18.0.0.144 on Windows and
before 18.0.0.143 on OS X and Android, Adobe AIR SDK before 18.0.0.144

before 18.0.0.144 on Windows and before 18.0.0.143 on OS X, when
Internet Explorer is used, allows attackers to perform a transition
from Low Integrity to Medium Integrity via unspecified vectors.

crafted web site, aka "VBScript and JScript ASLR Bypass."
